Reviews.Title: “Nice place on the edge of town”
Reviews.Author: FurtherNorth
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights at the end of April. It's a good place to stay if you don't want to be in the middle of the "tourist" areas but still close enough that you can get easily about. Two tram lines intersect here - #26 which goes straight to the central train station (3 stops) and #10 which follows a semi-circle around the downtown area hitting most of the major attractions. Several restaurants and pubs in the immediate vicinity with good menus. These aren't tourist places (but they still spoke fluent english) - just good old normal local hangouts. Jamie Oliver's Fifteen is just a 10 minute walk along the water (towards the train station) if you want to try out something a little more upscale. As others have noted there is a medium sized grocery store right across the street which is perfect for buying snacks and drinks. There is a liquor store just down the street as well. I stayed in a 3 star room which was rougly half the cost of a standard room from the hotel chains located more centrally in Amsterdam. And while there was some obvious differences in standard differences (a small, old TV, some of the furniture was a bit worn, etc.) this hotel more than makes up for it in charm. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was well stocked and clean and the room I had was extremely large. I had a room facing the water and had windows on two sides, which I can recommend. A friend who was staying at the hotel at the same time was on the other side of the hotel (facing the tram) and while the room was just as nice it didn't have much of a view. He was also disturbed a bit by the trams at night (which I didn't hear on my side of the hotel). I was there on a weekend and there is a disco across the street which can be heard well into the evening. I'm not particularly bothered by noises so I had no problem sleeping, but I imagine that if you are sensitive to exterior noise it might be a problem. The hotel itself is an interesting building with an equally interesting history - so don't be afraid to walk around and explore! The staff is great, very helpful. If you are going to the museums (van gogh or rijks) buy your ticket at the hotel and skip the lines (which even in the off-season are long!).

Reviews.Title: “Adjust Expectations and You'll Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Unwilted
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Lloyd Hotel. The key here is to know what you're getting into. If it is not for you, you'll be unhappy. If you know what to expect, you'll be very satisfied. Others have explained the concept. Different stars all in the same hotel. You'll see people who look like they belong in a hostel checking in right next to people wearing business suits. Those who pay for the lower-star rooms will probably be satisfied -- as long as they are essentially expecting a hostel or a low-end hotel (even though creative and clean). Those who pay a lot for a five star room (we did) could be unsatisfied because this is not some fancy place with full service. It is an experience -- you'll get a crazy room. Great for somebody who has seen it all and needs something new. All that said, I'd stay at the Lloyd again but I wouldn't spring for one of the four or five star rooms. We paid for a five star room. It was crazy, it was cool. But if I were to pay that money again, I'd probably rather have the comforts and service that comes from a more typical hotel. However, I'd jump at the chance to stay here in a two or three-star room. The location is great -- away from the craziness but easy to the center of town and there is a grocery store and a few other things right there (tip: tram can get expensive quickly -- either commit to a multi-day pass or rent a bike). We didn't try the restaurant, but it looks nice.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flyguy68
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel, it has everything; from very good, beautiful and special 4 star rooms with excellent beds to very cheap 1 star rooms with bunk beds. Every room is special. There are some wonderful extras to the hotel, like a nice restaurant where you can eat but also buy the sheets you have slept on, or read a magazine in a beautiful couch. There are several different corners, with little expositions or bookshelves with a wonderful collection of art books. This is truly a different hotel. I have enjoyed it on many occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley H
Reviews.Content: So I am American living abroad in Northern Europe for a few years with my wife and 2 children, having said that this revew of the hotel recognized several issues in Europe and if you have traveled in Europe before you might relate the issues I will bring up. 1) Not all hotels (Sofitel, Novatel, other properties) do not allow more than 1 child. 2) Not all hotels can provide a cultural experience as well as a comfortable hotel room. 3) Many hotels in Europe do not offer a view as well. The over all hotel experience was good. The TV was small, but I didn't travel to Amsterdam to watch TV. The rooms are not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Our room was comfortable (all beit a little unorthadox with the bathroom setup) and it offered a fantastic view of the harbour, was close enough to the "action" of Amsterdam yet not so close that you could not rest. There was a convienent tram stop nearby, a grocery store accross the street and a resturaunt on site. The staff were friendly and all spoke fluent English. Keep in mind that this hotel is not a luxury hotel (Sofitel), but rather a great cultural expereience that is affordable for the travel. Offering a historic building and a fantastic view.

Reviews.Title: “Lloyd hotel - comfort and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TereKrejcirova
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a lot my stay in Lloyd hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My room was very minimalistic but still it preserved the very special atmosphere of the past.Original place to stay. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Lloyd Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ReinoudvAssendelft
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lloyd Hotel Amsterdam since we had both bought tickets for Cirque du Soleil and an invitation for the Jazz Experience with Wouter Hamel at the Heineken Experience in the weekend of March 31st/ April 1st. Our room was modern designed. Bathroom with all convenience in the room. Nice window shutters. Our request for a quit room was very well taken care off. The hotel did not seem very crowded. We were very pleased with the bar-service late in the evening when we returned to the hotel after the show. Very personal attention by the lady bar-keeper. Good glass of wine and excellent old Dutch sheep-cheese. A delicatesse! We had a very good and quit night. The box-spring bed (1 matrass) was excellent! Nice breakfast buffet, although somewhat expensive (â‚¬ 17,50). We will certainly recommend the Lloyd hotel in Amsterdam to friends and business relations. The atmosphere of the hotel is very guest-orientated. The design is 'down to earth but also grand'! One feels 'at home' very easily. Staff is friendly, although one feels sorry for the people at the receptiondesk, who have to work in a very small ( former elevator) room! Great hotel, we will come back and we can recommend this hotel very much! Reinoud van Assendelft de Coningh

Reviews.Title: “Lloyd Hotel is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki_54321
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3-night-stay at the Lloyd Hotel. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. It's really nice to stroll through the hallways and find st new around every corner. The staff was really friendly, we had great food. I can absolutely recommend Lloyd Hotel for staying in Amsterdam! :-)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, Lloyd Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: If you want a semi-exotic but affordable and comfortable place to stay and network, then the LLoyd Hotel is the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lloyd Hotel, A`dam NL”
Reviews.Author: Selim K
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I`ve stayed in Amsterdam. Not only the architecture and designs are in conceptual novality but the service and the food was worth trying. Very quite suburban location but just a few minutes`s tram ride to the Central Station (tram no 26) and to the Museumplein (nearby P.C.Hoofstraat)and Leidseplein (tram no 10).. Definitely I`ll stay there next time. You get your money`s worth

Reviews.Title: “Great Special experience in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Alina R
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Very different from anything I every stayed in. Quite a difference from small hotels inside an old building wich are plenty all around the center of Amsterdam. I case you stayed in such already, Lloys is your next choice. 3-star rooms are good price and a special experience. I had a room with the shower in the middle of the room, which was very cool and very comfortable. The room is very big. The hotel itself in an experience, with all the books on modern art, the photos on the staircase, and many more things to explore... Food is quite simple and great at the same time. The only question is the door to the neighboring room that ensured I heard everything that was going on the neighboring room. So in case you want to be noisy, make sure your room is not one of those...

Reviews.Title: “the place”
Reviews.Author: asma93
Reviews.Content: a unique place to come home after a busy day. i enjoyed very much my stay in lloyd hotel. the âœ¶âœ¶âœ¶ room i had, offered all i needed in beautiful ambient. i like the concept of having a special star system with different categories under the same room. the only thing that could be improved is the restaurant, in particular the breakfast. the price seems too high in comparison to the offered cold buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Absurdly kind people in an extremely fun hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shanta7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the room that has an 8 person bed. It was silly, great and fun. The hotel has its own library and art projects and is historic in its own right with great photos and documentation. It's near the tram line and near some very cute places. But what was overwhelming was the kindness and thoughtfulness that went into the place. What other hotel has cradles and a doll bed in the hall? We used the doll bed and the lovely man who cleaned our room even made the doll bed. The people there were kind and sweet and even though it has an extremely cool vibe, it doesn't have a 'cool' attitude. We loved the Lloyd and we loved Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Leeeeeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a 3-star room on a business trip. Check-in was quick and painless. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. My room was cavernous, and I can safely say I've never been anywhere quite like it. It's such a unique building with an interesting history, and beautifully decorated, although it is a little out of the way in terms of location. The bar and restaurant were excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return”
Reviews.Author: bbboontje
Reviews.Content: Very characteristic hotel in historically turbulent building (beginning 20th century). We (2 adults, 2 children) stayed in a 4 star room consisting of a separate bedroom, living room, kitchen and bathroom. The room and hallways really have a year thirties atmosphere. No high-tech stuff in the rooms, but if you appreciate the atmosphere this is really inspiring. Very beautiful place to eat breakfast, lunch and have dinner (open from 7.00-1.00). We also liked the range in types of rooms from star 1 with shared bathrooms to star 5 as this results in a nice mixture of guests. Using the tram closely to the center; or just a nice walk away. We find Amsterdam's eastern docklands anyway a very nice place to stay with a nice mixture of new and old buildings. Very very friendly staff. Together with citizinm (actually the opposite as a high-tech hotel), is Lloyd definitely a recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theogeor
Reviews.Content: During a recent business trip to Amsterdam a group or us due to booking issues had to spend a night at the Lloyd hotel. The hotel is a short trip by tram from the City center or a long walk (especially when its cold it looks longer). Staff hotel were very friendly and efficient in check in us in. The hotel is an old building with a lot of history by the way so not your traditional hotel as per say. The rooms although very large have an interesting open plan layout including toilet :) which is not a problem if you are alone.. Not all rooms are like that by the way but be warned Everything is very clean and the bed was comfortable and warm enough despite been one of the coldest nights of the year. In terms of amenities and services it only had a tiny 14" CRT TV which did not bother me by the way. I would rate the staff with top marks and that always makes a lot of difference in any hotel however be aware of the unusual style of the hotel so as not to get surprised

Reviews.Title: “Unusual place (but in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: Jem W
Reviews.Content: An interesting hotel on the edge of the City centre (in the old dock area). Really worth at least a night if you enjoy non-chain hotels with character.The Lloyd has loads, partly due to its former lives as a prison and a centre for migrants. The restaurant was good, which is useful as the weather was pretty bad on the evening we were there and as it's a bit out of the centre there's not much else very close (although if the weather was good you could take a nice walk along the old docks). The rooms are interesting - ours had a mobile bathroom. But if I have one small complaint it's that there was nowhere to hang your clothes, which is OK for the one night we were there, but if you are staying longer I would just confirm the facilities your room has. But overall well worth a night of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Old historical building, plain but stylish rooms, bit off the city center”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an old historical building which used to serve as a quarantine station and later as a prison. The rooms still kind of a prison atmosphere, which makes them quite interesting and unique. The service staff is friendly and the hotel offers a nice, stylish and popular restaurant. Here you also get your breakfast if booked. The hotel has its own canal cruise station which is quite convenient. Although the hotel is bit off the city center, it is quite accessible with public transport (tram lines 14 and 26) which bring you straight to central station or the city center. Yet, the hotel is a bit on the expensive side which is however standard in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sarahschlepstar
Reviews.Content: Hello. I read reviews online to determine where we would stay for our two nights in the city. We have a four year old son also with us. The beds where phenomenal, so nice you felt heaven like in the linens. SO much so we bought a set when we left. The restaurant was nice and cozy. The ladies at the front desk were helpful and they sold train tickets and gave advice for perfect ideas to do in the beautiful city. Parking was 22euro a night extra, so if you are booking on price, take that into consideration. Also the bathroom was very standard, nothing even remotely special. Easy to get anywhere in town because the train/tram stops just in front. Our four year old had no problems seeing the entire center from this historic hotel. We loved the stairway with the unique history documented on the walls of the hotel. A great hotel choice when you take a trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Winterweekend”
Reviews.Author: Pia K
Reviews.Content: I was glad to see another dimension of Amsterdam in the form of Eastern Docklands and its smartly converted old warehouses and historical buildings (such as Lloyd Hotel). This hotel building oozes character and charmed me with its long corridors and with contrasts of old architecture and warm impeccable service. Sumptuous breakfast is served in an airy room with at least 7 meter ceiling height, and if you feel like having a cup of coffee to your room look for a small coffee stations (at least on the 2nd floor corridor) where you can make yourself a cup of coffee at any hour of the date. I also loved the furnishing of my room - smart and austere at the same time. Shower was funny enough placed in the middle of the room by the wall, without any wall or curtain fencing it off - brilliantly practical and simple. There is a superfast tram-line right from behind the hotel to central station - and it generally took me 15 minutes to get to central Amsterdam. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for something new while staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and interesting plus great service and atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: jenpalm
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner spent 4 nights at the lloyd hotel in chilly february. We went for a 3 star room and were very impressed - stylish, big comfy bed, spacious and a shower slap bang in the middle! Not like anywhere we had stayed before. As all the rooms are unique, on arrival, as I had read in previous reviews, we were offered the possibility of changing our room if the initial one offered was not to our liking - a nice touch I think. I hadn't taken a hairdryer with me but was able to borrow one from reception no problem. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. We had breakfast/brunch in the hotel each morning and ate dinner in the hotel on one of the evenings. The food was of a consistently high standard - simple ingredients, cooked well - I particularly enjoyed the grilled sea bass with yellow beets. There was always a lovely relaxed atmosphere in the restaurant/lounge and we popped in several times for good coffee/hot chocolate. The hotel is also well situated on the 10 and 26 tram lines - 5-10 mins (3 stops) from central station on the 26 and the 10 takes you all the way down to the museum district. I would definitely recommend the lloyd hotel to any friends visiting Amsterdam and hope to be back myself in not too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing standard about this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bergsie
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, clearly says that their rooms are not all the same and I have to say that they are true to their word. Stayed here for just one Night and had a great room. Got a FREE upgrade and had a great room, with a large comfy bed. If you want something different, fun and handy to get to and from, then you should consider this Hotel. I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “original all together but misses charm and warmth”
Reviews.Author: niels f
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the romantic hideaway in Amsterdam, Lloyd might not be your first pick. Depends on what you call romantic of course. The hotel itself is due to it's architectural style and original destination (partly a prison and migration center) not very cosy, but of course it is a gem in it is own typical amsterdam style. Design, "archi" freaks en trendspotters might like it the way it is. People looking for something completely different as well. The 0 to 5 star principle is rather limited to your choice of room, not of service or food quality (teh same for all guests). As such I picked right in the middle with a 3 star room. The bed was great, the room large and the bathroom cold and very basic with towels that you would rather expect in chinese bunk hotels. But altogether I felt like paying the correct price, no surprise in either sense of the word. I wouldn't hesitate to ask the reception to see multiple rooms as they all differ even within the same price category. The restaurant area is nice with high ceilings, but again, it misses some charm to feel comfy and at home (if that is the experience you are looking for). Breakfast buffet is overpriced, better grab a coffee and croissant and go into town for a real brunch. During weekdays the (new red and rather small) bar is mainly visited by business people staying overnight with their colleagues after some meetings/brainstorms in the building. Staff at the 'reception' was welcoming and charming, the lady at the restaurant rather rude in her answer on a simple and polite request for scrambled eggs: 'absolutely not possible and that it is not her responsibility to take care of some, talk to the management if you don't like it'... Finally the hotel is not centrally located but with tram 60 just in front you are within 10 minutes at the central station so it shouldn't stop you from picking out the Lloyd as your exploring base. Conclusion: it's original, I like dutch designers (responsible for furniture in the rooms), it's worth a visit but don't expect something that makes you 'glow'.

Reviews.Title: “young_ukraine”
Reviews.Author: young_ukraine
Reviews.Content: Liked very much, just what've expected and even more. The ambience is beautiful and the staff is helpful and sincerely glad to welcome/help you. Thanx!

Reviews.Title: “Good concept, time travel at Lloyd”
Reviews.Author: JoostDenmark
Reviews.Content: I had the great pleasure of staying in one of the 1-star rooms, with a bathroom just next door. Good service, fine harbour view and inspriring atmosphere. A good hotel, not only for design and art fans.

Reviews.Title: “The best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: Robbie_P0
Reviews.Content: With 25 people we stayed 2 nights in this hotel. Staff were casually dressed and very friendly. reception was quick and responsive. All in all good value for money. Standard but good quality breakfast. Also the meeting room beautiful. The beds are the best hotel beds i have ever slept in! I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced pretentious hotel! - be careful not choose the 1 star room!”
Reviews.Author: Leylaom
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at this hotel for a week. Ended up in the 1 star room with a shared bathroom. These are awful! There was a horrible smell in the room. One of the staff just let themselves into the room one night thinking it was empty. That was quite frightening. There was an art exhibition on in the room across the hall. The staff were moving around furniture in the middle of the night with no concern for guests. The only good thing I can say is that the beds were clean.

Reviews.Title: “be open minded”
Reviews.Author: kim59Aberdeenshire
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for our stay at the Lloyd, 4th floor room 409, next door to the shared bathroom, bit noisy but ok. however the shared bathroom was really that, I walked in on a guy sitting doing his business on the loo with the door wide open. I did risk taking a shower when it seemed quite, they were in need of a good scrub & a refurb. No tea & coffee in room but in the hallway, ask cause you'll never find it other wise. The bed was comfortable & clean. Room on the 5th floor had tiny window you would need to stand on a chair to look out. they did have private bathrooms on the landing, I did start using these instead of the 4th floor ones. Staff seemed friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not your regular hotel”
Reviews.Author: YVRWu
Reviews.Content: Other reviews already pointed out some of the unusual features of this hotel, which is located on the quiet water front close to the cruise ship terminal, an ideal location for an overnight stay before and after the cruise. The staff was friendly & helpful. Internet in the room was free and worked without any problem. The restaurant downstairs, with a good choice of wine by the glass, served tasty but pricey meals. However, there are several restaurants, grocery stores and deli shops in the neighbourhood frequented by the locals. One fish shop in the mall down the street, with a long queue at lunch hour, served a variety of seafood take-outs at reasonable prices, and the herring I tried that day was probably as good as it can be. For those who are health conscious, a morning stroll/jog along the water front would definitely help to kick off the day in the right mood.

Reviews.Title: “Very medium”
Reviews.Author: miloli
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I came back here a second time as it confirms what I felt the 1st time. The concept is nice on paper : the hotel offers rooms from 1 to 5 stars. But the problem is that the quality is not there. Rooms seems to have been designed by graduated students as part of their school project. It's very inconvenient and unfriendly. So you pay for a 3 stars but you have the service of a 2 stars (no hair dryer, poor tv, no safety box, cheap furnitureâ€¦) Despite the nice restaurant room, the food is very common and choice is quite reduced to have a proper dinner. So all in all it's not a good value for money, and set apart from the center. Also bad experience when I discover that breakfast was not included (they didn't said or write when I ordered) so I paid 17,5EUR for a coffee and a bowl of flakesâ€¦ Good point though is the free wifi and the staff nice (more at the bar than reception though)

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun alternative”
Reviews.Author: Peggy_Pegster
Reviews.Content: This place is not for the faint-hearted whom has a fix idea what bathroom, bed room, toilets, hotel rooms suppose to be. Lloyd hotel is a building with an interesting history - ex detention centre, ex immigrants' centre etc - you need to really see for yourself to appreciate how brilliantly interior designers/architects turn this institution, almost hospital-like architecture to a Hotel. I chose a 3 star room, in the basement , although I am a frequent traveller, it took me about 10 mins to orientate myself in the room and realize how my prior concepts about how rooms should be is rather strong. There are no doors for the toilet and shower (a forest shower) which is both seperated by a wall. The shower 'room' or more like compartment is so massive , it can fit 10 people easily. Room is extremely clean, and the bed I have to say has the most comfortable duvet and mattress i have ever slept in!!! I love the duvet so much I almost bought a Llyod Hotel design duvet .... I kinda regret not having at least the pillow case.... The uniqueness of the bed placement translates to comfort and privacy (huge contrast to the openess of the bathroom)- king size bed fitted snugly into a what looks like a cubic cove in the room - with the walls of the cove painted bright yellow - creating a funky contrast to the contemporary grey walls and wardrobes in the rest of the room.... Would I come back again? a definite YES - a mere 10 min train ride away from town, comfortable beds and clean rooms, the never boring interior design filled with character. Although there is occasional frustration as there are usually only 1 person serving a few at the reception - but hey, you are in Amsterdam - what's the rush for? :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anleeb
Reviews.Content: First we've been disappointed how far away from the train station the hotel is until we found out that by car it takes longer to get there than by bike. Our room was great and I cant stop thinking about the bed and linen. Just the best and I slept like a baby. Breakfast isn't cheap but oh so yummy and the ambient just great. I took so many pictures and will recommend it to everyone. The hotel is renting out bikes, it's so easy to get around on a bike.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sino_newScouser
Reviews.Content: The concept of having 1* to 5* rooms is great. Translation is another thing though because the service does not span that range. Definitely quirky rooms but many have an open toilet, which is fine if you are single occupant. Restaurant not great.

Reviews.Title: “great vibes”
Reviews.Author: vtski48
Reviews.Content: an easy tram ride from the central train station, this unique hotel has interesting rooms, great restaurant, and a staff that is helpful and courteous. the only drawback is that there is not much within walking distance. but the hotel's charm, and uniqueness make up for that shortcoming. the trams run frequently and we would definitely choose to stay here again. the rooms are clean, spotless, actually - a quiet spot, relaxing and with lots of ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Oooh my god the beds are to DIE for!”
Reviews.Author: MsHolliers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 star room in this hotel and thought it was very quirky. The building is really historical and the decor very much wants to reflect the buildings original use. They deliberately play on the oldness of the building in the communal areas (except the restuarant which is brilliantly modern). The bed was HUGE, and the most sinkable, delicious bed i've stayed in. It was hard to drag yourself out of it once you got in. The room was so unique, it's a room that i wont forget. The wardrobe was essentially some really cool art deco style hooks on the wall. The room was really large, as they'd cleverly hidden the toilet, shower room and sink behind a door that you pull out into the room. Very cool! The room didnt come with an iron or ironing board, or a hair dryer - but reception did bring these up to us no problem when we called down. There was a wedding on whilst we were there, so they were quite busy but the staff we always very friendly and attentive. The 10 and 26 trams go right by the hotel, and its only 3 stops away from Amsterdam central on the 26. Costs â‚¬2.60 but you can get a 24 hour pass for just â‚¬7 that you can use on any tram for that 24 hours. The tram station is less than a 3 mins walk behind the hotel. I would come back to this hotel again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing 5 star was the price!”
Reviews.Author: cloud9leeds
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel, billed as it was as one of the trendiest hotels around. Whilst I can't deny its style, everything else is over-rated. The public areas still have all the charm of its previous incarnation as a detention centre. Reception is a tiny cramped cabin and the welcome no better than a Premier Inn. We chose a 5 star room, but the only thing 5 star was the price. Yes it was large and had the 4m wide bed that my kids enjoyed jumping on, but at â‚¬300 I expect more than an tiny old CRT television bolted to the ceiling. The towels were old, tired and small, toileteries sub-standard, no mini bar, no robes. I could go on but you get the idea. The location is not convenient for town, and the taxi's at the station start their meter at â‚¬12.70 making it a â‚¬16.00 trip. The restaurant was OK, but barely 10% full on a Friday night which must say something about it. I'll not be going again, and suggest people give it a wide berth unless you really value the quirky style over everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, out of town but enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: off-and-away09
Reviews.Content: You can easily use the trams to get into/from town as it stops 30m from the hotel. We booked last minute so there were only 2* rooms available. It was actually a lovely, but quirky room. Firstly these was no-where to store clothes -you sort of hang them from the wall, and there were lots (and lots!) of wires on show everywhere, but again I think this was part of the style. However, we had one of the world's longest and biggest bathrooms-larger than the room itself! I suppose it was a "wet room" because after a shower you had to mop most of the room! It was interesting that the hotel showed it's history in a display in the stairwell, they could have made more of this really as it was great to see the history of where we were staying. We liked that it was a little out of town as there was no hussle and bussle which you can get in the city. There is an ATM and supermarket opposite so that was handy. We hired bikes from the hotel and got the ferry up into the country which was a real highlight of the trip but....there were no breaks!! We were the only tourists we came across who relied on the traditional back pedalling to break approach! You have been warned...... We were not massively impressed by the staff, I don't think I could use the word "friendly". Reception is tiny and badly placed so you all sort of huddle in the corridor while the 2 members of staff poke their heads through and everyone competes for space. We were also charged for things that we had already paid for. They produced a "signed for" receipt which actually had an incorrectly spelt name, on pointing this out there was no apology and then as we asked for our bags to be kept in the hold you honestly would have thought we were guests from hell. The tables at the back of the hotel catch the evening sun and it is quite a popular spot. Biking into the city did not take long and is along the river but we did find that buying a tram pass made travel very easy.

Reviews.Title: “unique, fine, and with a lovely restaurant and terrasse”
Reviews.Author: gail005
Reviews.Content: One can choose a 1,2, 3, 4 or 5 star room. just depending on the size of the room and price you want to pay. 24 hour room service very clean everyone speaks English of course, like basically everywhere in this country, especially Amsterdam. fine restaurant open till midnight. 10 minute tram ride from the Central Train station, i.e. "downtown" There is an elevator, which is not usually the case in old Amsterdam buildings. often there are narrow, steep stairs up which one carries one's own luggage. been there, done that! get health insurance if you are coming to Amsterdam! no joke. I would definitely stay here again if I come back to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Striking Building, Great Service, Competitive Rates”
Reviews.Author: MEJT
Reviews.Content: We found the Lloyd Hotel when we drove into Amsterdam late one night with no where to stay. Driving in on Rte 114 from Utrecht, you see the Lloyd just as you enter Amsterdam, when you are in the Eastern Docklands. We were greeted by very friendly staff who gave us a "last minute discount" on a triple room and they even had a staffmember on hand after midnight to add the extra bed (since the room was set up as a double). You have to read about the Lloyd (I'm sure they have a website) to get the full picture -- in short, it has been both a hotel and a prison in the past! It was brilliantly redone a few years ago. The center of the building is lots of open space with a beautiful restaurant at the ground level and various places to hang out (kind of like lofts, floating above the restaurant) on higher levels. The hotel rooms vary greatly in decor and price (they try to provide options for all budgets) and the building is also a cultural center. You can enjoy free internet/computer use and there are games for kids and books and newspapers to read... There is a great vibe. The hotel was buzzing with activity when we were there but very quiet for sleeping. It's an unusual (special) place and we are very glad that we had the chance to stay there. It's probably an easy bike or tram ride into central Amsterdam but I don't know that I would want to base myself there if I had a whole week, say. There are two supermarkets, a couple of banks, and two bakeries across the street from the hotel but not much in the way of restaurants, it seemed. The hotel restaurant looks great but we were only there at breakfast time and we skipped the 17.50 Euro buffet. (That's my only complaint about the Lloyd. Breakfast was way too expensive.) So, I think the Lloyd doesn't really offer the Amsterdam street life experience. BUT, it offers a unique experience and the people were fabulous and it could definitely be a great base for experiencing the city and the culture in a new way.

Reviews.Title: “Money in luggage flew away”
Reviews.Author: Martintang
Reviews.Content: Firstly the good thing about the hotel is cultural and clean, but it doesn't really feel much like a hotel, instead, a B&B. The overall service is just fair, we booked it in advance through zuji, but when we arrived, they had no record and we need to wait for an hour for checking in. In the first day out, we left the wallets inside a luggage which is locked. Of course it may be not wise to do it, but it was too late when we found 300 euro was gone when we back while everything seems fine in the appearance. Probably it was stolen by the clean-up staff... We were very disappointed with this hotel and would not recommend to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel... but a good one”
Reviews.Author: rahulh7
Reviews.Content: We had two twin rooms, and were told they were exactly the same, except they weren't. Our room had the main door from the hallway that lead to our bathroom, rather than the room. The showers, had no curtains, and the only way in to the room was through the bathroom, which limited what you could do (whether you could come and go from the room) when the bathroom was in use. The beds were very comfortable, but if you're facing the road/canal side, it can get quite noisy both late at night, and early in the morning. Overall our stay was acceptable given the affordable price of our 2* room but I would be very careful in booking this standard room unless you're expecting a hostel level accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mej49
Reviews.Content: I return from a weekend at the LLOYD hotel, it is a very good hotel, not useull, stuff are very freindly, room very nice (2 stars) I would come back again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Design - Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Daisies55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, on a complimentary bases, so I guess I shoudn't complain, but honestly, people should know what this hotel is like before they decide to go. I'd certainly not recommend it if you are bringing your loved one for a romantic break. I would recommend it, if you are into modern art and design and love "interesting" history of buildings etc. I'd also recommend it if you love to be offended, insulted, ignored and mistreated by hotel staff. You will be then pleasantly surprised by the range of bodylanguage, face pulling and tones of voice, rolling eyes, tutting, or staff raising your voice at you. Sadly, customer service is where this hotel badly let us down. Pretty much all staff need a good intensive course in customer service. Be careful as on arrival you might miss the smallest reception area in the world - something resembling a shower cubicle, painted yellow from the outside, paint peeling off in places. But I guess you won't really miss it, there will be a good few clients stood queueing and being insulted by the reception staff already, not knowing where to stand or sit as the reception area is in a narrow corridor, exactly at the spot where you should also be accessing the hotel's restaurant. The girl who checked us in rolled her eyes, and scowled in a really abrupt and bold way at the other customers while I was waiting. It just made me wish I never came to Amsterdam. First finding my, and other customers' names' on the reservation list... is my name spelled with a K? "yes K for cat"? Erm well not quite... "NO IT IS NOT YOUR FIRST NAME I WANT. LAST ONE!!" and "Jeeesus, I am doing it NOW!!". I was shocked. Really shocked. I understand this is probably the world's first hotel to offer a range of 1 to 5 star rooms. Good on you, interesting! Sadly, the service you will get will be the same regardless of which room or how much money you pay, or how you therefore expect to be treated. We were a "right pain in the a*ss" cos we asked other questions.. as I politely explained I was writing about the hotel for a newspaper so I expected a press pack to be waiting for me. After a search and being told there wasn't one, this repeated 3 times, but I insisted, as I really needed this, so in the end the stressed girl walked off and came back with a press pack about the hotel (in Dutch!?), which needed exchanging later, underdstably for one in English. The girl was trying to sort out request of another two customers as well as a group cheking out... My patience and understanding wasnt however appreciated, when I asked if I should wait, or perhaps come back later, she snapped at me. I am serious, snapped. Sadly, I also wanted to ask about an iron and ironing board, as we were due to go out shortly to a restaurant where we had a meal booked. She snapped at me again, because I asked if she knew how long it might take. It is such a shame that I was simply left feeling like every single thing was trouble, anything I asked, or perhaps would like to ask. Nobody tells you anything about the hotel, its service, Cultural Embassy, which the hotel is known for, or even where to get your breakfast. So off I went into our room. Apparently a "4 star exceptional room", this must refer to the design I guess in some strange waym, or perhaps just the size of the room. Despite being a couple, we had two single beds, so soft I did my neck in while sleeping two out of the three nights. Luckily, our bathroom wasn't in a middle of the room unlike some of other customers, but slightly separate, in a kind of half circle alcove without a door. Pretty spacious, and so was rest of the room. So those were the good points. The funkiest green-red-white flower deisgn carpet I've ever seen and the white whooden blind shutters on inside must have been the main feature. It also had the smallest TV I have ever seen (not sure if this is also somehow part of the 4 star design), but we weren't interested in TV, so whatever, really. It just made we wish the TV simply just wasn't there. I guess something must have happened to the original bigger one, which explains the spare TV remote control I found under my bed. Interesting lamps, beside tables and one white painted wooden chair - this must be some of the design specimens that are scattered throughout the hotel, its rooms and corridors. We weren't that keen on those funky wooden window shutters by the time the light came through them come early morning - there were no curtains to block out the light. Our ironing board and iron turned up soon, that must be the 1 star one, as the cover was detached and slid up and down, and iron churned out strange dry white crystals. Better than nothing, I guess. Getting ready was difficult as the only mirror was the small one in the bathroom above the sink. So we took turns to jump up and down in front of it to check out our outfits. (At least we had a laugh, I guess) Breakfast area is a huge tall ceiling bright room with a range of seating from comfy sofas to a communal bar style canteen type. Food offered was far from a good range, but enough to set you up for the day. (just because there is yoghurt one day, doesn't mean you should expect it the next day). You were also "stalked" by an "Ann Robinson lookalike" who kept frowning over her glasses, checking out and following customers and slipping them little pieces of paper to fill out, to establish who they were and if they were indeed entitled to their morning food. No good morning, no smile, no welcome. One gentleman stood over the empty tray of cheese and dared to ask, so "Ms Robinson" brought out another, but surely, she really didn't have to comment this by loudly calling over his shoulder "More cheese! just in case you haven't got enough!". So despite originally planning to speak to the manager about a possible tour of the hotel (to help me when writing the article), I resorted to avoiding any unnecessary contact with staff, after the rudeness experienced on the first night. I guess it shouldn't have been a surprise when returning to the hotel at night we walked into the bar/restaurant area for a drink and asked the waiter if it was open, only to be given a bold, blank faced, answer: "FOR??". "A drink, please?"... Yes we can? Phew.... thank you... Room service .... A lady walked in on us one morning without as much as a knock on the door. Nevermind. Next morning she must have decided we didn't need our soap and shampoo topping up because we still had some pieces of the tiny soap left over from yesterday. We still managed to use some of it before it melted into non-existence. The toilet could clearly wait to be cleaned til the week after. Nevermind. Enough of that though, I feel really tight now for stating the negatives. But I do feel the service was terrible. So on to the good points - the hotel has a fascinating history, it used to ba a way station for migrants leaving Europe, as well as young offenders instute, a prison etc.... with all of this incorporating into this design, and interior. Many of the original elements, parts or layout have been therefore preserved and reused, despite sometimes lacking in functionality. This hotel is to be marvelled at almost like at a design museum, so we did make sure to go for a walk around its corridors and staircase with photographic exhibition of the ongoing work. It is unique, apparently no one of the 117 rooms (or so) is the same, each different. One has a grand piano, and a bed that sleeps eight... It is fascinating to look at, but a little harder to enjoy as a guest. I wish the management would reconsidered the tiny reception area, and some staff training. The treatment of the customers I witnesses, just is not acceptable. Since we have been back, the management have apologised to us and sounded pretty shocked and surprised to hear what the experience we have had. They said they take the issue seriously and will be looking into it. I am glad, because the unusual and unique place this hotel is, if only a few people made us feel a little welcome, smiled and controlled themselves from snapping and raising their voice at customers, we could have had an unforgettable experience - in a positive way...

Reviews.Title: “An awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Looker097
Reviews.Content: NEVER STAY HERE over priced!! Never stayed in a place as bad in my life we stayed for 3 days and cost us 612 between 3 of us rooms were so spooky, dont no how they can rate themselves as a 5 star it's more like a -5!!! Staff were so rude too.

Reviews.Title: “A good price for an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: alexandrebrasil1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in one former dockland area, mostly residential. It gives a nice vibe,near the water and it is silent. The rooms are good, with many variations between them (and their prices) for what I could gather. We stayed at the cheaper ones with bathroom and have nothing to complain about it. The only downside is the distance from the centre of Amsterdam, forcing us to take a tram trip. The stop is near the hotel and it's not very far away, but if you plan to party hard all night it may not be your ideal place to stay. If you donÂ´t mind getting public transportation, buy a 24 hour ticket or some other similar. In short, it's a nice hotel, with a fair price considering what one can be charged in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design - not worth the money though.”
Reviews.Author: roter_hirsch
Reviews.Content: Ambience: Great modern hotel, situated in the eastern docklands of Amsterdam. Relatively close to Central Station. Good tram connection. Integrated in an old 1920s building. Open design, great open restaurant and terrace (see photo). Lots of Ikea-like designed furniture, but I'm no expert in interior design. Rooms intergrated in the original period building design. e.g. stone floors. Directions to rooms are not displayed. Stars: **** Room: We had a "5 star" room. Stars ONLY refer to room size, NOT to facilities. No fridge, not enough towels, no shower gel, no minibar, tea and coffee only available in the corridor. Ancient, small-screen TV. No radio. No closet. No sink in the WC. Small windows, not a good view. Large room though, with a nice hammock. Bed very comfortable. (Its the "5 star" room displayed on hotel homepage, upper right picture, 360â‚¬ per night plus taxes. Breakfast NOT included!). Overall stars: ** Service: Non-professional receptionists (students?). Find your room alone - staff do not assist you with this. No help with bags. Room service looks cheap, but there is a 7.50â‚¬ extra charge for delivery - this additional charge is not displayed in the menu, but we were told on the phone when we tried to order something. The staff is friendly, free coffee while waiting for the room. Waiters very friendly, but still inexperienced? Stars: *** Restaurant: We had excellent squid rings for a fair price. Steak comes plain, with no sides - chips cost extra. Quality of the steak: questionable. Also pasta with mushrooms: Ok. Overall too expensive for what we got. If you know good restaurants, you will not like this, however, they describe it as a "snel "fast" restaurant" so you wouldn't expect anything more. Breakfast was good, though not included. Sorry, only **. Overall: ** (Would be three stars, but it's way too expensive!!)

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating comfortable hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mel2824
Reviews.Content: The Lloyd Hotel is a great hotel for a family (as we were) but we would recommend it also for anyone who likes their hotel not to be a uniform chain style. The restaurant staff were really friendly to all of us and brought the children their own pot of chocolate sprinkles at breakfast. Nice food at dinner, too. The beds were REALLY comfortable. The Lloyd Hotel is very quirky. The rooms are all very different to each other. We had 2 3star rooms (for other adults in our party) and 1 4star room. The 4 star was great with children as it was a very big room divided by dividing doors into 3 normal sized rooms. The first had 2 single beds for the children. The second was the bathroom and the third a very light, nicely decorated double room. The 3 stars did not have lots of cupboard space but were fine for a weekend. One of them had an enormous freestanding bath in the middle! The hotel has lots of nooks and crannies to explore, staircases all over the place and photos of its prison past. It is in the Eastern Docklands but is only 5 minutes from Centraal by tram 26.

Reviews.Title: “Totally overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KnechteGott
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 days. So all i have to say is that all we got were damaged walls and floors. the rooms are very manky. The toilets and showers were separately, but they were usually too dirty. The service often forget to finish their work. Only the location was good, there is a tram directly to the near Central Train Station

Reviews.Title: “A uniquely Dutch experience!”
Reviews.Author: AliRuth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lloyd as part of a press trip so I can't comment on the tariffs, but I know there are several levels of room/service to choose from. The Lloyd is set in an old immigration/child detention centre near the docks, but the refurb has been wittily and cleverly done, with only remnants of its former self left. The rooms are simple and clean, roomy and warm. However, be prepared for the bathroom to be a little quirky! My bathroom was positioned in a corridor between the entrance area and bedroom, with double doors for privacy but no locks and no alternative way through to the bedroom - fine (just) for single occupancy, but not so private for shared ablutions! Other rooms had a shower positioned in a corner of the bedroom, with mop provided! Try this hotel if you want something different from your stay, rather than just another anonymous, eponymous hotel room. The bar is small and fun, and breakfast was conventional continental, but tasty and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Dealt Well with Issue”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Untraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a revised review of the hotel after they really went above and beyond the call of duty to help me with a misfortunate event that happened there. First the good: This building and people are really amazing. From the open dining hall full of community meeting places, art work, and friendly staff to the rooms that are clean and unique in character, this is the place to stay if you want a thinking person's experience of Amsterdam culture. The rooms vary a lot in price and layout, so if your room doesn't suit you, you may find a better one if there is space. It's also next to a lovely canal-lined island that forms a great 1.5 jogging loop if your'e into that. The revision: I had the unfortunate experience of having my iPad stolen from my room while in this place. I sincerely don't think this had happened before as the staff was at a loss what to do. The helped me file a police report and after no recovery of the iPad they paid for its replacement. Outstanding. I'd highly recommend this place to any traveler to Amsterdam. It's a cool place and even the worst experiences were made right.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: r3ddwarf
Reviews.Content: I did enjoy the stay, I will list the pros and the cons Pro -nice price -close to the trams -helpful staff -sweet to be able to order food in the middle of the night (it was possible in the hotel) -cool rooms cons -It was to far away from the city center to be able to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Third time lucky!”
Reviews.Author: Xerys
Reviews.Content: Can this hotel put no foot wrong? This was my third year in which I returned to the Lloyd Hotel, basically due to the fact that it is easily accessable by tram and when renting a car it has safe underground parking. The hotel features rooms ranging from 1 to 5 stars with corresponding amenities. Thus far I've erred on the side of 3* and upwards and have yet to be disappointed. The hotel has a truly unusual character and it grows on you, especially if, like me, you prefer chain hotels like the Radisson etc. This hotel is nothing like it, yet has a charm all of its own. In-house dinner can be expensive but worth the cost. I've returned time and again for teh liver with onion with mashed potatoes - a basic peasant dish really, but the way they serve it up makes it truly special. You can easily conduct business here over breakfast or dinner. Somewhat surprizingly, when we enquired about alternative dinner venueswithin walking distance of the hotel they recommended the Jamie Oliver restaurant about a kilometre or more's walk away - during winter with snow and sleet coming down. However, literally if you step outside the front door, to the left is a cosy restaurant called De Cantine with a wonderful atmosphere, pleasant staff and a menu to suit most wallets.

Reviews.Title: “Different but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jjscoot
Reviews.Content: My partner & I were booked here by the organization that he was having meetings with. Nice old building, good to see it being put to use. Believe we must have been in a 3 star room and the receptionist wanted to make sure we had room 505, which she said was nice for 2 people. I had mentioned to the woman booking the room for us that I would prefer space or a view - both of which we ended up having. Quirky layout but manageable, a peg to hang a coat or a flat surface or drawer to put things besides the desk would have made things easier but for 3 nights no big issue, then again this was the room we were in. Breakfast was included & good for continental - fresh squeezed juice, fresh fruit salad, nice cold meats & cheeses & breads - but seemed steeply priced to me, not sure I would have bought it myself. Grocery store & organic shop just down the street, not even 3 minutes walk. GREAT restaurant across the bridge - de Wereldbol - went for a walk and saw it, read the menu & a woman outside having a smoke told us it was "the best" and she was right. My kind of place though - small kitchen so limited menu choice, a "this is was what was good at the market today" kind of place. We had steak & fish and I have already made reservations for our next trip there this week. Are we staying at the LLoyd on this trip? No. Would have if I could have gotten a deal but the regular rate didn't justify staying again. And it is a bit out of the loop - you pretty much have to depend on the tram line that runs near the place. Nothing wrong with the place though.

Reviews.Title: “If you like nightmares, this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: idiotsunseaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just not a hotel; it is a mess masquerading as a hotel, and they don't expect you to complain or even notice that you re being fooled. Because finding hotel rooms let alone reasonably priced ones, is almost impossible in Amsterdam, so prices are painfully sky high and standards shabbily low. The pictures on the booking site (we used hotels.com) were deceptive. The price was 150 euros for a room, and the place was advertised as 3 star. However on arrival we were directed to a gloomy destroyed former hospital room, with broken tiles, hospital beds and dirt everywhere. it was depressing, and after being moved to a room without broken tiles near a noisy corridor, we decided that this must be a Dutch sort of joke,; to see how we would react or something. The reception was staffed by dis-interested student part timer types, who really didn't get it that people were paying good money for this hole, On further investigation we discovered that the hotel provides 1 to 5 star rooms in the hotel, thus giving itself an average 3 star status. This is misleading, and in any case does not work, as the reception area was like entering the front of a run down school; 1 star. Apparently the spooky building was a former reform institution, and they had taken great steps to try to preserve this character. It just isn't comfortable when you pay good money, and it certainly isn't a hotel. The shower in the room was in the room, and was a shower head and the floor with a drain hole and a flimsy shower curtain; like you get in hospitals. The place proclaims itself as a "cultural embassy" as well as a hotel. So what you get is a place full of posing and intense "artists" with the emphasis on scruffy and loud. In the morning, the new room to which we were sent, was filled with the noise of this "work" with people running in and out, having coffee at the table just outside the room door. It seems that the Dutch will try to sell anything by giving it a mis-leading title, When complaints are made, they give you that Dutch charm, which on further investigation is a grimace that hides the fact they cannot be bothered with you. After all, it's money for old rope in Amsterdam, where you could open a cardboard box as a hotel and make money in your sleep from tourists who need a place to stay. What was most bizarre about this place was the freaky notices left on walls like "Go up the lift to the 3rd floor and you will see a door going up a stairs. What is behind the door?". This plus a corridor full of empty baby cots and dirt, dirt, dirt everywhere was I suppose to give the impression of artists at work or the avant-garde. If you just need somewhere to rest as a hotel, then this place is the worst place imaginable. If you want to lap up the artistic atmosphere and not book in, then you can use their library or restaurant, but the trip from the centre will take you a good 45 minutes on foot, or you could try one of Amsterdam's expensive taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Quite A Different Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jnjtiger
Reviews.Content: Novel hotel built into a former hotel from Lloyd Steamship Line. Later a juvenile detention center! Completely refurbished in very avant-garde style. Very artistic theme and orientation. NOT in central Amsterdam, local tram takes you to Central Station in 10 minutes. Good shopping area directly across street with two grocery stores. Good gym for workout fans nearby, Fit 4 Less, 10 Euros for the day. We were at Lloyd for a training program at the hotel. If touring in Amsterdam, suggest something more in the center. Helpful staff, rooms large with unusual touches - open showers and toilets in some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting & enjoyable but wouldn't do it again.”
Reviews.Author: KCW_11
Reviews.Content: We were excited to be staying at the LLoyd between Christmas and New Year 2010 having read previous reviews about its quirkiness. It is a bit grim on initial arrival, but given its history that was no great surprise and we looked forward to seeing the 5 star room we had booked. We were allocated room 608 on the top floor and were taken aback on opening the door to see grafittied on the wall ahead of us "contaminated"! Must be "art" thought us and proceeded into the room. It was long and narrow with the functional space arranged along the higher part of the room in boxed off areas under the beamed roof. The bed was an organic upholstered shape that extended out of its boxed area into the main part of the room. This was definitely quirky and would have been appealing were it not upholstered in green nylon fabric. There was more graffiti on the far wall (behind a hammock) stating "bed monsters" and by now we thought the grafitti was less art and more a warning from a prior guest. What little freestanding furniture there was, was mismatched, old and rickety, of the sort you might expect to find in a junk shop. No desk, chair, wardrobe, it was a space more akin to an artists studio than a hotel bedroom. Reception were surprised at our request to move but moved us to room 124. This room could have been in a completely different hotel. It was huge, light and bright with a conventional bed and attractive furniture. The quirkiness of this room we were able to cope with - statement lighting and a view onto the lounge and restaurant below. The bathroom, was a prefabricated fibreglass unit that wasn't attractive to look at but was entirely functional. We had snacks and drinks in the restaurant which we enjoyed, especially the locally brewed "end of year" beer, and the staff were helpful and friendly. We also ate in the Cantine restaurant just round the corner from the hotel and would heartily recommend the chicken sate in this establishment. In short, the Lloyd appears to be a bit hit or miss depending on your room allocation. My advice would be to ask to see alternative rooms if you are not happy with your initial allocation as they do seem to vary greatly. It was an interesting and enjoyable stay, but having had the experience of it, I wouldn't rush to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel--a great value!”
Reviews.Author: harmony128
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a 2-week vacation, and we wish we had stayed longer! We booked a "2-star" room, and it surpassed all our expectations--it was roomy, comfortable, clean, and even overlooked the water. Quite charming! The restaurant in the hotel was great for drinks (I loved the mint tea!) but just OK for food, but there is a group of shops just across the street from the hotel and quite a few restaurants within walking distance, and we found some inexpensive yet delicious places to eat in the neighborhood. The hotel is a bit outside the main hub of the city, so we had to take the metro trams to get into the areas we wanted to explore, but once we figured out how to navigate the metro system, it was quite easy to get around. There is a metro stop a short distance behind the hotel, which was very convenient. If you're in Amsterdam and want to find a good value for your money, this is where you should stay!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in a museum”
Reviews.Author: Orjee
Reviews.Content: Lloyd hotel was a pleasant surprise for the experts from 6 differnt countries from three continents who participated iint the Expert meeting organized by the Royal Tropica lInstitute(KIT),Amsterdam between 13th and 18th.Septemebr,2010. It had all the comforts of an extremely well managed hotel along with the luxury of avant garde ambiense and surroundings. Strongly recommended for visitors with any budget in view of all thedifferent tiers of packages available with superb hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “a dysfunctional overpriced hotel. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: mort35
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a three star room. My room layout was OK, after I rejected the first room offered. First the good news. The bed was great. End of good news. Now the bad news. I found the room very traveller unfriendly. No safe, no mirror except a small one in the bathroom. No note paper and pen. TV had a broken housing and the TV reception was very bad. Both bedside table lights didn't work. No bar fridge. Towels were very old and threadbare. The bathroom comes complete with a mop to clean up after you shower, because the design is so dysfunctional. I found the hotel staff to be poorly trained and at times abrupt and rude. Room service, which is advertised as 24 hr, did not exist late at night.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: JR_Essex
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a '4 star' room, on the positive side the bed was comfortable and the room clean. The room however was open plan and with no wardrobe, just hooks on the wall for clothes, all of which hang in the bathroom area - so you could sit on the loo and see your shirts hanging on the wall in front of you!!. the shower was good but always left a puddle on the floor. Sleeping was also a problem, the shutters were insufficient to keep the room dark (no curtains) and the noise throughout the night (particularly on saturday night) meant sleep was almost impossible. If you do have the misfortune to stay, ask for a room at the back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: trolldans Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel and rooms looks very nice on the web abd they claim they are located in the centre of Amsterdam City. They are located OUTSIDE of town as far from 'leidesplein' (where you want to be) as possible. We came and got a room in the basement. It was actually the basement and it smelled that way and looked that way. Another word is BUNKER. With a free view from the outside and down on the bed. We complained but with the rude response from the staff we decided to not stay. Then the staff wanted money for having reserved the BUNKER/ROOM to us. This is a SCAM.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: marknmeils
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a 3 star equivalent room, which from reading some of the other comments must have been one of the better ones. We had requested a water view, but when we arrived early afternoon to check in, the room was not available. We were given the choice of another room which we could have immediately or a couple of hours wait. We opted to take the available room as we had walked from central station having been given some very poor advice and directions on the proximity of the hotel by 2 red shirted city guides "helping" people outside the station. Whatever you do, if your coming from the station make sure you catch the tram 26 (IJtram) and get off at stop Rietlandpark!! The room we were given was basically a bed and a huge bath - it was nice in a quirky sort of way but way too small and we didn't intend to spend the next 2 1/2 days in the bath! We went back to reception and after a short wait were put in our original room with water view. This room was everything the other wasn't - it was spacious with table and chairs, an alcove for bags, queen size double bed. It also had shuttered windows, funky carpet, and of course the river view. The only odd thing was that there wasn't a door on the bathroom/toilet, but overall we were very happy with the room. Otherwise, the staff were friendly and helpful, there was wi-fi in the room and there were tea/coffee facilities available in a hall cupboard. As noted, the hotel is well away from the city centre, so buying the 2 or 3 day travel pass is worth it. There is also a supermaket across the road from the hotel for picking up any supplies. As explained by another reviewer, the continental breakfast in the hotel restuarant is expensive at 15 euro per person, but there was plenty to eat and it was very tasty (the freshly baked baguettes were to die for!).

Reviews.Title: “Different, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mrmobi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in various rooms at the hotel while I was working in the city for a couple of months in early 2010. This is certainly not your usual hotel, but the rooms are spacious and warm. The beds are amazing with superb linen and are always made up to a high standard. The restaurant menu is limited and expensive, breakfast was almost Â£20. There are a couple of good restaurants nearby which were great though. The hotel itself is a little out of town, but you can get a tram to Centraal Station literally right outside which takes about 10minutes. If you get a cab back make sure the driver DOES NOT take the freeway! It adds about 10Euros to the cost! If you're feeling like something different to your usual hotel experience then Llyod would definitely be worth trying out, I had a very enjoyable stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky-but charming”
Reviews.Author: laurenslaugh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend. It was a 15-20 minute walk (10 minute bike ride) from the main train station. It is on the water and is a quiet area. The workers were very helpful and allowed us to keep our bags before check in. We stayed on the 5th floor and shared the bathroom and shower. The towels and the robes were wonderful. The room used to be a cell so it was small but the beds were very comfortable. I suggest buying breakfast in advance since it was an expensive last minute purchase. It had a nice museum in the hotel explaining the extensive history of the hotel. Great value for the money. They offer different rooms for every budget. I know the larger rooms must have been wonderful!! Oh, bring earplugs...some loud drunks may stumble in after hours

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disorganised. Don't think all rooms look like the website!”
Reviews.Author: mistykid3000
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel. My friend who I was travelling with had stayed here previously and highly recommended it. Therefore we returned hoping to be put in a room similar to those advertised on the website. Not so. Our first room was in the attic with one small window and tiny bathroom. We were moved to another with the least amount of fuss, but wonder if we would have paid 120 euros for a dungeon. The second room was bigger but still a long way off from the designer furniture described so often on their site and in leaflets. Breakfast was not included and they charge 17 euros per person for a buffet option. We didn't eat in the hotel. Service wise reception is very slow and when we ordered drinks at the bar we waited 20 mins before asking again. The waiter had clearly forgot, then tried to charge us for dinner that we hadn't eaten! In the morning the room didn't have a hairdryer so phoned down for one and it never arrived. Upon checkout waited in a long line of other guests who had several complaints. Sadly the idea of the hotel is better than the reality, and it could be a really cool place if they were a bit more honest with room descriptions and improved on service/more staff. Location-wise it's nice to be away from Centraal Station and getting a tram is easy enough.

Reviews.Title: “It Use to be a Prison!”
Reviews.Author: David_Justin
Reviews.Content: We went to our first room and it was so bad that I thought my friends had given us the wrong key as a joke--it was no joke. We then requested a second room. It looked like the first with a clean coat of paint. So we then got a 3rd room which was still nothing great. The restaurant is beautiful but it was 15 euros for a continental breakfast. The place was a prison until 1989 and had a creepy feeling to it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and in need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: jorrit9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in both the basic rooms as in the so called 4 star rooms. The basic room is with a shared bathroom in the hall, which looks like an old school shower. The room itself does not even have a sink. It is very noisy because of traffic outside. The room looks extremely basic, still they charge you 90 euro a night plus tax. A rip off. The 4 star room sells for about 200 euro, depending on the season. It's also basic and noisy and there are many much better options around. Notice that you pay and extra 20 euro a night to use the parking garage. On a positive note: the staff is friendly. The restaurant is ok. There is free wifi. It's definately not a trendy or comfortable place!

Reviews.Title: “Special but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Geert-Hilde
Reviews.Content: Very special hotel with much character in an old but renovated building of the immigrant autority in Amsterdam. The fact that this is an historic site and that the building has been renovated with respect for its history of course has some implications: lots of stairs, small corridors, every room is different...those who like the big chains perhaps will have some difficulties in appreciating this hotel. Our rooms where large and clean, the bed was very comfortable, but - and this is a big but - the bathroom was INSIDE the bedroom, no partition at all. We used the rooms as singles, but I can image that if you have to share a room, of even with your partner, this lack of privacy will not be appreciated. Nice restaurant and bar on the ground floor with good quality products. The location is good for those who do not like to be in the inner center of the city. The neighbourhood is safe and quiet, but you have to take a bus or a tram to the center (takes about 10'). This is not a cheap hotel, we had a 2* star room for 150 euro, but this does not include the city tax (7 euro) and breakfast (17.50). All in all, special but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Scary, lack of facilities, cramp..”
Reviews.Author: Munzter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days at the 2 star rooms. The reviews were good but in reality, it is really not worth it to stay here at all. The rooms were Euro 150++ and we stayed at the lower ground floor, which is like a dungeon. The rooms were small (elongated rather than square areas), the carpet is very rough, the cupboard is extremely old & musty, the bathroom is an open concept (meaning no doors, so its freezing) and mostly, it gives out a really scary aura. Definitely won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Service, noisy and too expensive”
Reviews.Author: mojito2010
Reviews.Content: strengths: - nice old building with history (old prison) weaknesses: - too expensive (very bad price performance) 150 â‚¬ for a two star room !!! - bad tv reception - rooms looks like hospital/prison - old towels - lousy unfriendly service - addtional extra fees: parking 22 â‚¬, touristfee 7 â‚¬, breakfast17 â‚¬ - to far form the center - noisy

Reviews.Title: “Nice trendy builing”
Reviews.Author: Dutchcowboy
Reviews.Content: Old builing, trendy style. Only 5 minutes with the tram to the city. Good parking, breakfast. More for business than pleasure. Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Lloyd Hotel - Rooms can be very different!”
Reviews.Author: gardenofengland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night break in this hotel. The hotel is as everybody states different. Booking in was slow but the receptionist was very polite and helpful. Our first room (116) 3* would have been lovely but unfortunately the shower/bathroom was being refurbished so was out of action e.g. no tiles or shower base but it was quite large and sunny and being on the corner overlooked the canal. When we explained to the receptionist that it would be nice when it was finished she was almost disbelieving and we were asked to wait in the bar area for it to be checked. The hotel was very busy with several conferences so I think their may have been a problem with finding us another room! We were however, given 2 free drinks and then another room 502. This was no where near as nice as the first â€“ more 2* standard, the wet room was dark and municipal looking, but the bed was very comfy. The breakfast, we thought was very nice with a good selection of cold stuff, cereal etc but this was included in our deal and I would not have paid â‚¬17.00 for it. We did not eat any meals but had a few drinks in the bar/restaurant area which was comfy in an IKEA type way. The furniture looks better than it is to sit on. But there is a lot to see and a wander around the hotel is a must to get the full experience. It is well situated. We travelled by car and left our vehicle in the park and ride and it was 1 stop on the tram up the stairs and into the hotel reception could not have been more convenient. The hotel is on the docks about 30 mins easy walk from the centre of Amsterdam, but we were very lucky with the weather so might not have been so lovely in the pouring rain but the tram is a minutes walk away. Amsterdam is undergoing major road works with a new station being built so it was difficult crossing the roads with all the - I can only say aggressive cyclists not very pleasant to walk around in most areas because of this. However we would recommend the Lovers dinner cruise, it was good food, lots of wine and friendly company worth â‚¬69 each with the 2 hour canal cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money it costs or the fame it boasts”
Reviews.Author: OrbisNauta
Reviews.Content: The problem lies with its concept - pretending to be different and offering rooms from one to five stars. Something had to be wrong, and it is. The Lloyd Hotel might be an interesting choice when it comes to 2/3 star rooms, but malfunctions when it pretends to serve the top stars. You can't seriously state to have an offer of 5 star rooms and when one of its guests says it wants to iron a shirt, they simply put an ironing board at the room... They were supposed to know that 5 star isn't just the size of the room and the price tag, but in Lloyd Hotel it is. Bad service allround, quite vulgar restaurant, staff not helpfull - they use their reception to dry out the kitchen forks as they answer requests from the guests. The major drawback, still, is the distance from the center. It is too far to walk and you can surely get a tram but, with temperatures around 8 below, the â‚¬ 17 taxi fare to the center seems very cheap. With all the hotels lying in the city center, Lloyd doesn't make much sense.

Reviews.Title: “very good fun”
Reviews.Author: worktravellerglobal
Reviews.Content: We had a such a lovely stay. We loved our room â€“ the staff where fantastic and food so good. It was so good to have a escape from the craziness of Amsterdam. I stay in so many big posh hotels for work and this was such a refreshing change. Its nothing like a Sofitel or Hitlon with their snooty staff and hideously bland rooms â€“ this is so unique. More homey. Also â€“ because there are a full range of rooms available price wise â€“ there are a more diverse and interesting range of people staying. Not a whole load of bankers in suits that's for sure! The only thing missing that meant it was not 10/10 was big fluffy towels and robes â€“ I think you should get that for the price. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, but slightly strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rikki_H
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Lloyd Hotel for 2 nights in December 2008 as part of our honeymoon tour of Europe. The hotel has a strange history, as it was once a juvenile prison! (Some parts still look like a prison, especially the reception) The hotel has 5 floors: the 1st floor being 1 star, 2nd floor 2 star etc to 5th floor being 5 star. We stayed in a 3 star room, which was small but charming. I must say the linen was exceptionally comfy with feather pillows and a feather duvet.
