Our bath shower head had a mind of it's own, and when we asked the manger to check it out, it sprayed water all over him! Staff were a bit rude, and the breakfast was a continental spread, so unfortunately no eggs & bacon. Overall we enjoyed our stay, and it was easy to get around as the train stops across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, an excellent base for an Amsterdam adventure”
Reviews.Author: MrsLauraLea
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 star room for three nights, the room was very big and clean and although the bathroom did not have a door it was very functional. The staff are efficent and helpful and the links into central station and other parts of town are very easy to follow as the city has excellent public transport. My husband and I will be visiting the Lloyd again but perhaps bump ourselves up to 4 star for the privacy :)

Reviews.Title: “Such a bad experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: VADV
Reviews.Content: We have booked the 5 stars room for one night especially asking for the room with the piano or the on seen in the picture on the website. Once there the first thing we noticed was that the hotel was far away from the city center. The hotel from the outside looks like a mental hospitalâ€¦. When we checked in they did not find our name and it was only after having shown us the name of all the guests booked in the hotel that the finally found our name. The room was not ready until 3PM so we left the luggage there and went for a city tour. Once back they let us pick up our luggage in the room; without checking the tags numbers. We arrived in a room which is 222, that looks like a sauna. Entirely in wood, with a plastic bathroom hidden inside a wood panel on the left side of the room. Why is it a 5 stars room because you have a bed that can fit 8people completely useful for a couple! We asked what was happen with the room we asked for and they simply said that they were taken. We insisted and finally had the chance to visit another 5 stars room on the first floor.....the walls were broken and dirty in different point, the lights on the night table was broken , the library in the room looks like one you have found in the middle of the room you have decided to take back to your place. The bathroom is once again in plastic and really looks like the one a 2 stars hotel. We asked to have bicycles and they said they only have 10 for the hotel (117 rooms) therefore of course there were no bicycles at our disposal. We had friends with us looking for a babysitter and they said they were not able to provide it....And all of this for 275euros per night.....special rate founded on their website because normally the room costs 550 euros per night!!!! Stay away from this place, really not interesting!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: IsraelNili
Reviews.Content: The Lloyd hotel is the worst hotel we have ever been to - and we have been to many hotels throughout the world.... The information concerning this hotel, being a 5 star facility, both in the web and in the Time Out of Amsterdam is false and misleading. The only detail which might fit into a description of a 5 star hotel is the price... This hotel served as a prison for many years. Unfortunately, the prison atmosphere is still maintained in the quality of both the rooms and the staff. We have never come across such an insulting attitude of an impertinent, non-intelligent staff, as we experienced in this hotel. We were given a "five star room". The room was on the third floor, facing a noisy street. It contained a bed and a huge (for at least 10 prisoners) unnecessary cupboard. It's only use was to serve as a shield to the water coming from the wall-free, "surprising shower" (from the web..). We had to mop the floor each time we took a shower. There were no dark curtains. In fact, no certains at all, just "stuck" shutters which did not block the sun light at 5 a.m. In fact, it was impossible to sleep also before sunrise, due to the unbearable heat in the room. The temperature that day (3-4 July) was around 35 degrees. Not only the "5 star room" was not airconditioned, it was impossible to open the windows for providing the guests an opprtunity to get some fresh air. To my surprise, in the morning, when we told the man in charge about the terrible night we had, he did not express any sympathy. Moreover, he told the spoiled guests that he himself does not have aircondition at home. He explained that it's impossible to open the window for safety reasons "Do you want us to be responsible for the life of guests who smoke and jump?....It is the same in Hilton!". He just ignored the fact that Hilton is fully airconditioned.... The "pleasant" conversation, , with additional two staff members, continued. At the moment when they accused me of lying concerning a promise I was given on my arrival, I decided to leave. I took our luggage (my husband was already "sleeping" in the conference) and left. In this "5 star hotel" there is no one to help with the luggage. I was angry and tired and the result was that I fell of the stairs in front the hotel. The taxi driver who found me lying on the floor, suggested me to sue the hotel. I don't intend to sue. I just want to warn people from staying in this less than 1 star hotel. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “You'e in Amsterdam so try it at least once...”
Reviews.Author: BBeeps
Reviews.Content: Our company employees have been staying at the Lloyd every September since it opened (we were there when they were still setting up and got to see the designer in action putting in the final touches). We love the place because it keeps on surprising us, the staff are nice and the restaurant downstairs is very pleasant and open at all hours. But unfortunately in the last two years the prices have become a little too high during the IBC trade show period. A few tips if you are thinking of staying here: 1. If you are not on your own or with a very close and loving partner ask for a room where the bathroom an toilet are sectioned off (in many rooms the toilet and shower a simply smack bang in the room just like any other stick of furniture). 2. Try to avoid the rooms where you walk in straight to the bathroom (we had to make up codes for 'don't come in I'm on the toilet, showering etc.' and the floor was always wet and messy...). 3. The rooms on the 6th floor are the funkiest but if you are tall you may want to avoid them because they are in the rafters. 4. It is worth paying the extra fee for reserving exactly the room you want because some of the rooms can be a surprise you would rather avoid. 5. If the hotel isn't fully booked we have always been able to shop around for a room that suited us best. 6. It is located on the outskirts but this new area is very cool and there are many nice places to hang out (check out the Odessa boat restaurant just on the bank in front of the main entrance, they are not always open and reservations are needed phone: +31204193010). Anyway with a bike or the tram you are in the center of Amsterdam within a few minutes so this shouldn't put you off.

Reviews.Title: “If you liked Dieter on SNL you'll love the Lloyd Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zebra56
Reviews.Content: When my daughter and I arrived the hotel was hosting a design exhibit sponsored by Elle Women Magazine of Europe. This went on for two days and we were very obviously in their way. The reception/lobby is a closet stuck in the middle of the hall with a Dutch door (pardon the pun). We were lucky if there were two employees in the "closet;" otherwise, there were always five or six people lined up trying to check in or out or just to ask questions. It was all too, too "all about me." "Me" being the hotel and its employees and the regulars. They were enjoying each other and the hotel's uniqueness way too much to be bothered with the guests. I can only reiterate what the previous reviewers have said about the service. There pretty much is none. Actually, the service is poor all over Amsterdam, but the Lloyd Hotel pales in comparison. On at least one occasion when my daughter asked for coffee she was told, "I'm really busy right now. You'll have to come back later." And it doesn't seem to be the fault of too few waiters, just incompetence and indifference. We were under the mistaken impression breakfast was included (it had been at every hotel we'd stayed at in Italy, Austria and Germany). Imagine our surprise when we found out we'd been charged 17 Euro ($25.50) for a continental breakfast - and not a good one at that. The Lloyd Hotel was, at one time, a youth prison. We had two cells for a room. The front door opened into the bathroom! If you happened to be sitting on the toilet and your roommate opened the door - you were exposed to the entire hallway. No shower curtain, just a low curb around the shower with the shower head pointed straight down very close to the faucets with no ability to move it. They provided a squeegee for stray shower water, but no drain to push it into! And you couldn't get the water back into the shower for the low curb! When we check in they had folded a hand towel over the sink and lowered the stopper and left the faucet dripping. The towel was sopping wet. Only a curtain between the bathroom and the bedroom which consisted of two beds and one table and two chairs (and the tiniest TV we'd seen in Europe - although we don't go to Europe to watch TV). We had to put one of the chairs in between the beds for a make-shift nightstand. There were four lights with magnetic bases stuck on a magnetic strip that went around the wall about five feet high. None of them were where you needed them. Quite frankly, I can't believe anyone recommends this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “horrendous service, needs a good lick of paint, way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: expatinlondon17
Reviews.Content: I've just recently stayed at Lloyd Hotel for a work trip. There's nothing to like about this hotel. It's overpriced, and in the middle of what looks like an industrial estate. The rooms may have been cool and design-y at one point but now they just look shoddy. The walls are scuffed, the layouts unhelpful. All of this could be put up with except for the fact that the staff is uniformly useless. Coming in at lunch inbetween meetings after sitting at the table for 5-7 minutes in an almost empty restaurant we finally asked if they had any menus. The response was "yes, we do". Wasn't sure if we were supposed to go and find them, as they didn't seem inclined to get them for us in any hurry. Attempts to get a drink at the bar turned into a farce of being moved from one room to the next with staff that might at some point come over to serve you if you're lucky. The staff at the front desk don't seem to grasp that you might want to check in or out sometime in the next decade so you feel like you're forever waiting for someone to actually get they're in the hospitality industry. Breakfast is incredibly expensive--you pay 17 euro for effectively a continental buffet. And I'm sorry but having to squeegy your own bathroom isn't charming or quirky it's just tragic. AVOID this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Different. An interesting experience.”
Reviews.Author: zwerf
Reviews.Content: The Lloyd Hotel is a beautiful old building (1921) with a solid institutional feel. Many of the original details are still there. It has a great breakfast, a nice restaurant and an outdoor terrace. There are several restaurants and bars nearby. The area around the hotel is a mix of old and new, but mostly new and a little non-descript.. Itâ€™s just a few metres away from a long dock on the Ij river (not just a canal) that gives a nautical feel to the place. And of course the building itself has a nautical history. Across the road thereâ€™s a shopping complex with a supermarket and ATM. You can take a tram to get into town. There is an underground car park right behind the building. The exit is metres away from the hotel. I was personally intrigued by the history of the building: I mean it was built by a shipping company as an emigrant hotel. It became a Nazi prison for resistance fighters. And then a regular prison. And then it became an artistsâ€™ colony. And now itâ€™s a design hotel. Go figure. I think I was in one of the two-star or three-star rooms. My bathroom was hidden behind a wall, which I could swing open to divide the suite into two rooms. There was no shower stall per se. The shower floor was wood. Yes, wood, with grates. I had tiny plastic chairs. The lamps were hanging on heavy pendulums hanging from the ceiling. At one point in the hall there were chairs tucked into an alcove one metre high! I mean, it WAS interesting. Different. Having stayed at Lloyd Hotel, I now know there are hotels that, well, defy a TripAdvisor-style rating system. The rating system on TA is already not that simple. A one-star hotel can get a 5/5, and a five-star hotel can get a 1/5. But how do you rate a hotel with one-star rooms and five-star rooms? How do you rate a hotel in which every room is apparently different? I mean, this is not the Ramada. How do you rate a hotel where you often find yourself thinking â€œnow why did they do it that way?â€� and â€œhow does that work?â€� The LH reminded me a little of the scene in Absolutely Fabulous where Edina and Patsyâ€™s Ã¼ber-trendy friends had an all-white dÃ©cor. Chic, but not always the most practical or comfortable arrangement. The LH is a very, very European hotel with the message â€œwe are cooler than you areâ€�, and where the designers apparently felt they had a mission to challenge hotel guests. Design magazines and design books are strewn around the hotel, as if this were something that everyone did. If you're a traditional sort of person, you may not like this hotel. I can see why this hotel might have confused some guests and resulted in them giving it low ratings. To many of us, â€œdesign hotelâ€� means â€œexpensiveâ€�, â€œmodern comfortâ€� and â€œluxuryâ€�. Well, think again. I thought a few aspects of the hotel were distinctly hostel-like. The communal same-sex washrooms, for example (just for some of the guests). The tatty psychidelic throws. I sort of liked this aspect. It's a distinctly Dutch thing to do. My reaction to this hotel is based partly on the fact that I was here only one night on business. If I had stayed here for a longer period and paid for the room myself, perhaps I wouldn't see it the same way. The conference room was uncomfortable in hot weather (a rarety in Amsterdam). No air conditioning. The room however was comfortable, mostly because I had a great breeze. It was fun and Iâ€™m glad I stayed there. It was an â€œexperienceâ€�. I would recommend it to open-minded people for that reason. Itâ€™s the kind of hotel you remember. The kind of hotel you expect to find in a city like Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Choose carefully...”
Reviews.Author: HappyMunching
Reviews.Content: I usually really like "design hotels" and make a special effort to stay in them. So when my husband found the Lloyd online, I thought we should try it, even though (since we are on a budget) we would need to stay in a room with a shared bathroom. Now I am sure there are some really cool rooms in the Lloyd, but at the same time I can assure you that the room we had was NOT one of them. Yes, it had historic character, and a kind of "psychiatric ward chic" (as one of the other reviewers described). It had funky green tile on the walls and floors, weird windows into the corridors (with blinds, yes), no overhead lights (only architect's desk lamps weirdly affixed high up on the walls), a small window that didn't open enough for adequate ventilation, a very basic desk with two chairs, and two single beds pushed together. The room was tiny and absolutely dismal, though clearly brand new. In its favor I will say that it was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and bathrobes were provided. We shared a bathroom with half the floor, and for some inexplicable reason the toilet was in a room of its own, while the lavatory was in a room with the shower. The hotel has an interesting display on the history of the building (which I would recommend you read on your way OUT the door on your last day as it's not a happy story), and there is a quick tram link to the Centraal Station. I would say -- try the Lloyd -- but make sure you know what you're getting into before you do.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy, but interesting”
Reviews.Author: Millennyum
Reviews.Content: I took the cheapest room they had, on the 4th floor and with a shared bathroom. I read that is was a 'different' hotel, but I wasn't prepared for the psychiatric institution look of my room... This floor had long, echoing corridors, and everything was covered in old tiles: dirty, crooked and with lots of filled up holes. The bedroom was basic. It had two metal beds, a desk where the paint was coming off, and two rugs. The tv didn't seem to fit in. I had a hard time reaching for the light switches, as the lamps were attached to the top of the walls. If you believe in ghosts, don't stay here, as there must be at least two per room! However, the bed was nice and soft, and the showers were comfortable. The restaurant was very arty and the breakfast tasty (although expensive). I didn't mind staying there just for a short night between two business days, but I wouldn't recommend it for a long vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: papercoversrock
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Lloyd. Friendly staff, inetersting interior, bright beautiful room (with a fold-open golden bathroom). It's a bit out of the centre, but that can be a good thing. Especially when it's sunny and you can ride a bike along the IJ. Or, it's well connected by tram: 26 to Centraal, or 10 to Leidseplein. They've done some amazing things to this old prison - not just a hotel, but a cultural centre as well! I prefer this unique experience to some cookie-cutter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's never too Lloyd!”
Reviews.Author: DoeHEAD
Reviews.Content: Despite its helpful and cheery staff. Despite its artsy and comfortable public rooms. Despite its convenience to public transit (three quick stops on tram #26 from Centraal Station). The rather quirky Lloyd is probably NOT for everyone. For instance, our room had cold hardwood floors instead of comfy rugs or carpets and was otherwise unadorned in any way. Room lighting was spotty and, aside from the beds, the only place to sit in our room was a single straight-backed chair. Furthermore, on occasion, the labyrinthine hallways and narrow stairways led me to dead ends while attempting to reach the lobby. (One could be forgiven a momentary flash on its former service as a prison.) Nonetheless, there is wild charm about The Lloyd's sophisticated lunacy: unexpected art objets strewn throughout, a multi-media exhibit in a stairway about the modern rehabilitation of the building, a sun-drenched, atrium-like dining area/library with fresh daily newspapers and a lavish breakfast buffet spread. Just don't go here expecting your mother's European vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful space, local color, excellent restaurant, cool bar”
Reviews.Author: cgerard
Reviews.Content: Stopped here on the way back from West Africa before returning to the U.S. Had a 3 star room--highest ceiling I have ever had, quite comfortable bed and rest of room was nice too. Hotel was close to metro and was in a transitioning neighborhood--so it gave a view on how locals live--even met and talked with some locals in the hotel bar. Excellent restaurant for dinner and breakfast or just a light meal in the middle for the day--I experienced at least one of each meal. Casual, but friendly service--which is what I like. I also liked being out of the typical tourist center and in an old neighborhood that is transitioning--this building has an interesting history--was a temporary housing for people on their way to start new lives in the USA after World War Two and was a prison after that. While not a "tourist" area the Eastern Docklands neighborhood has an interesting mix of old buildings and very new buildings. Would recommend this hotel for people who like comfort, but also like authentic surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Chandelier at the front, TV at the back, dining table in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: CallumLondon
Reviews.Content: We initially selected Amsterdamâ€™s Lloydhotel as it was the only Amsterdam city hotel available at short notice two days before new yearâ€™s eve. Their website stated rooms available ranging from one to five star â€“ not conventional for a hotel but we decided on the four star room expecting a certain level of amenities. How disappointed we were. There were three of us staying in a room but, rather than having one large room with an additional bed, we found the room had been designed in an â€œartisticâ€� way with a large entry area with no heating but a chandelier, leading on to swinging doors (which had no locks) to the bathroom. The bathroom also acted as the wardrobe and dining room! In addition, I was also disappointed with - The room divided into three sections, but only a single light switch at the front - Two large radiators in the back section (master bedroom?), but no heating in the other two areas - No tea or coffee making facilities - No fridge in the room - The TV was very small (something youâ€™d expect in a two star room) and the remote didnâ€™t work. The remote was never replaced when requested - The bedding, although good quality, was feather which one of us was allergic to. Housekeeping didnâ€™t replace all the pillows with synthetic ones despite multiple requests On the positive side, the hotel is well situated, the free in-room wi-fi was very good and the reception staff were very polite.

Reviews.Title: “There Was A Toilet In The Middle Of The Room.”
Reviews.Author: 80Traveller
Reviews.Content: The layout of the rooms must have been done by a designer with absolutely no common senese. My room had a concrete floor. My friend's had a shower not 10 feet from the bed, with no wall in between. And the best? The third memer of our party had a toilet in the middle of his room. Seriously, no walls around it, just chilling in the room in full view of the bed. It was the first thing you saw when you walked in the door. The bar was great, though, and the crowd was fun. That said, I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: emilia_8
Reviews.Content: Weve just returned...Really good hotel-friendly staff, clean bathroom (we had a shared one), comfortable beds, NOT smelly duvet and pillows...and building-you need to explore the exhibition, try to open and see as much as you can-you will be surprised! there is a lift but try at least once use stairs. Highly recommende. Opposite hotel is really cheap supermarket and view for canal.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again......simply an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sugden
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay a the Lloyd Hotel. it is my third visit here. Each year more and more people come with me, as they hear so much about this place. This year i booked 4 rooms. 2 adults and 6 teenagers in total. The reception staff worked hard to fit us all in on the same floor. My friend and i had the room with the yellow bathroom. We LOVED it so much. All the rooms were different and we were happy with them all. Everything is so quirky... Some staff remembered us from our previous visits and were greeting us like friends.i cannot think of a single reason why anyone would not love this place. Breakfast is so yummy... set us up for many hours. We cant wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disturbing!”
Reviews.Author: treegp
Reviews.Content: Well! My girlfriend and I had a 4 night stay in a 3 star room. It was a bit weird from the start! We had no idea or information from our booking website that it was a former prison hospital. It looked like doom from the outside and the corridors were morbid on the inside! Our room was big but lacked any storage space and tea/coffee facilities. The strangest thing was that the toilet was IN the shower, so it got soaked everytime you showered, hence having to keep the toilet paper in another room! There was also weird curtains with skeletons on them! Just what i wanted! NOT! Unless you are really really chilled people, dont stay here. The restaurant was very good though.

Reviews.Title: “Good concept; mediocre execution”
Reviews.Author: legaltraveller82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here almost two years ago in a "3 star" room which included a bathroom, and I had a great experience. This time I was in a "1 star" room with a shared bathroom, and I have to say I did not enjoy the hotel this time. A few things: a) the room itself was extremely bland, to the point of being ugly - there comes a point where minimalism and the "cool" just turn into unattractive and shabby; b) the shared bathroom concept is just poorly executed here. OK I accept not all rooms can have private bathrooms - fine. But if we are forced to share, at least make the experience as comfortable as possible. This isn't a hostel (or is it?) so guests should be entitled to some degree of privacy, even in a shared setting. First of all there are no male/female washrooms - just one for everybody. Secondly there is no separation between the showers and the sink area. It would be easy to put a locking door on each shower cubicle so you have an area to get dressed, towel off, etc without trying to do so in a wet shower stall or a public room. Finally the condition of the showers were absolutely deplorable. They just appear dirty and run down, and the shower nozzle itself looks like it is from the 60's. Generally the staff/management of this hotel seem to have decided on their own version of what is "cool", even when in another setting it could be described as cheap and lazy. I also had to comment on the TV channels in the rooms. I know you don't come to Amsterdam to watch TV, but after a long day I like to pop it on to fall asleep to. There is one channel on the TV that plays a video over and over again which is all about airport disasters, hijackings, plane crashes, etc. There is graphic footage of planes crashing to the tune of "Do the Hustle". Personally I am blown away by how idiotic and insensitive it is to play this video in a tourist hotel. Why the hell would you play a plane crash video in a place where you know that 95% of people go straight to Schiphol Airport when leaving? It's pretty sick and twisted - though the Lloyd management seem hell bent on finding out how uncomfortable they can make their guests while still getting paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, but...”
Reviews.Author: Oslofjord
Reviews.Content: Lloyd is a fun and different experience. The rebuildt prison has lots of surprises, and I`ve never stayed in a hotelroom thats anything like this. For instanse - the shower and toilet in our room was a gigantic, yellow box. We loved the design. But... And yes, there are a few catches. First of all - its a good walk to the central station. Rent a bike the first day, and you`ll be fine. But to walk the distance twice a day? You will curse it after a while. The noise between the rooms is also disturbing. We accidentally walked right in to our neighbour the first day. After the doors were looked properly, we could still hear them and smell every sigarette they smoked. Nice breakfast buffet, but very pricy. 17,5 euros for this???

Reviews.Title: “Run away fast ... very fast!”
Reviews.Author: Tippy23
Reviews.Content: Well...we actually never SLEPT at the Lloyd Hotel, because the instant we saw our room, we literally walked out (and checked out). We reserved the "5 star" room with the PLASTIC bathroom in the middle (which smelled like an out-house) - literally we thought it was a joke. Whatever you do, don't stay here...

Reviews.Title: “One of my worst hotel experiences ever!”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: I am usually careful to give only one star to the absolute worst of hotels. This one definitely earns it. Granted, I only booked this hotel because we had a rate from the conference I was attending. I did no homework on the place and simply bought the pitch that it was a designer hotel. What a mistake that was. I wish I had checked out the reviews beforehand. Anyone here praising the quirkiness of this place really has to be into "design". I found nothing in the place designed. It was the strangest feeling I ever had in a hotel. Because this place was a former prison, I somehow felt totally creeped out by it. Further, my room was horrible. I booked the 4star (or whatever the rating is) room expecting something better. The room had linoleum flooring which was beaten up, the toilet was standing out in the open in the middle of the three small separate rooms (I presume three separate cells). The two sofas were completely ragged. The shower had mildew. The windows were beaten up. The only thing somewhat OK was the bed but not even that was anything more than standard. I also found the reception extremely unhelpful. The people were fairly rude and seemed bothered when I asked for them to call a taxi for example. The restaurant area is OK I guess but it simply is not enough for me to have anything but the worst of impressions from this place. Think long and hard if you really want to risk it booking this place. it might be the kind of place which floats your boat since you're into this type of "experience". Yet, I highly doubt there are that many people who like this kind of thing. Maybe if Hostel 3 gets filmed, this is where they'll probably film it. You might get lucky and bump into a celebrity.

Reviews.Title: “interesting ambience, good value in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Palo_AltoPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: One of the few reasonably priced hotels in Amsterdam that can comfortably accomodate a family of four in the same room. 2 bedroom, one bath room, with beautiful windows. Convenient restaurant with simple, nicely presented, high quality organic food and an adjacent library. Convenient to the main station by tram. Easy walking distance, over scenic bridges, to the Science museum, and the Amsterdam Central Library . Nestled in a neighborhood with spectacular contemporary architecture. Atmosphere will be greatly enhanced when the indoor smoking restrictions go into effect next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Strange, very strange.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1310
Reviews.Content: Interesting & quirky hotel which is a great concept, but unfortunately doesn't seem to work as well as it should. The reception staff are friendly and helpful, but the service in the restaurant is pretty disorganized (it took ages for them to bring an order, then when it arrived it was wrong - this happened a few times). We stayed in a 2* room which had an open plan shower right in the middle of the bedroom, which is fine for a couple but not sure how practical it would be for 2 friends sharing. Also the we could hear people walking around in the room above us (and moving furniture about) really loudly, which was annoying and woke us up a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Place”
Reviews.Author: DanaZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a 1-star room. Our room looked a little like the set of an Eli Roth film. Walls and floors were covered with institutional tile, chipped and broken in places with discolored grout between. About 6 feet up, the wall was plaster as was the ceiling. Tile and plaster were separated by a wide metal strip with numerous electrical outlets. Light was provided by a series of individual work lamps clamped on to the metal strip. Beds were small twins with comfortable mattresses. The entire wing we were on seemed to follow the same plan with the institutional origins of the building clearly showing through. The 5th floor seemed a little better with rooms based on what appeared to be a series of administrative offices, smaller than ours but a little more attractive (not a difficult feat). The primary remodeling seemed to have been done on the large public areas in the center of the hotel starting with a very good restaurant and extending up by stairway through a series of lounge areas including one with an enormous set of art books. Decoration was spare and minimalist but quite attractive. The best aspect was a pair of working elevators quite sturdy with some rather eccentric elevator music. There are a flight of stone steps to the main entrance but signs indicated some other access for the handicapped. Shared bathrooms were coed which may concern the more awkwark or prudish. The hotel staff were variable but seemed anxious to help. A wakeup call came on time and the taxi we requested also arrived on time. When we asked to change rooms because of cigarette smoke, they responded quickly. They provided any information we requested and looked up online what they did not know. The tramline stops for trams 26 and 10 (adjacent but at different levels) were just in back of the hotel about half a block distant. Tram tickets were available for sale at the desk. It is possible to walk into downtown Amsterdam but takes about an hour depending on how quickly you move. The area is primarily residential with a small strip mall across the street including a grocery store, liquor store, and bank. The area seemed quite safe to walk around at night and the residential blocks seemed upscale. Hotel clientele seemed to vary but many were from overseas and many were young. The hotel restaurant was popular and crowded when we were there and deservedly so. Overall, I liked many aspects of the hotel but found the rooms exceedingly ugly and the walls though not the floor quite cold at night. That ugliness as well as the similar quality of the bathrooms force and the distance from the main part of the city are why I give the hotel a neutral rather than a positive rating.

Reviews.Title: “What a great spot”
Reviews.Author: jetset08
Reviews.Content: An absolutely great hotel in a City filled with mediocre hotels. If you're going to Amsterdam, this is where you want to stay. The staff went out of their way to make my extended stay comfortable and memorable. I had only to ask for something and someone knowledgeable was more than willing to help. Their staff is top-notch, the top rooms are unique and fun, the setting is very hip, not a trace of snobbery, nice clients, cool bar, great food, nice local area. I really love this spot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: slmnwn
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to Amsterdam. My Boss initially booked this hotel for himself but after the first night, he moved to another hotel and got me to replace him. I didnt complain because if I was him, I would have done the same thing. I didnt blame him because I understood straight away why he escaped from this prison.. it was one of the most uncomfortable and horrific places to stay. I slept very little and was paranoid most of the time.. the shower and toilet was togethar and it had these ugly looking tiles and the light was not bright enough. The overall view of this hotel is grey, dark, cold, and lonely. The worse thing was that the bathroom was mile away from my bed and thats where the light switch was so I had to walk all the way in a dark to switch the lights on or off. I could hear people closing and opening the room and walking outside my room. This place was a prison and if you see the hotel, it looks like a prison. They have not done anything to change it. The worst thing is that they are using its history being prison as a selling factor. I wanted to stay away from that place as much as possible. It made me feel extremely lonely. There is a feeling that unhappy people use to stay there ofcourse as it was a prison. After all that, its very expensive. The hotel charged us for 5 nights before I even arrived there. The breakfast was good. I would not recommend anyone to stay there and I think the prison should actually be used not as a hotel but as a historical place for tourist to visit. It can also be used to make a great horror movie.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: unx
Reviews.Content: This place is so different. It is really worth a try. Great beds and bathrooms (we had a shared bathroom but never encountered any problems) and a fantastic restaurant downstairs. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A real punishment”
Reviews.Author: Tymetravel
Reviews.Content: As a resident of Amsterdam you don't often stay in hotels in your hometown. The seminar I worked for had booked me a room in the trendy, fibrant & self acclaimed "cultural ambassady" the Lloyd Hotel. I really looked forward to spending some time over there. I'm sorry to say it was a terrible experience. The 'high concept' of the hotel gets in the way with basic needs, like hospitality. The whole place echoes its former function as prison. Litterary, because the accoustics are dreadful. The 'desiger rooms' are actually very poorly furnitured and a little awkward - f.e. you really have to like having a toilet in the middle of your room. The staff decides which programs 'of cultural interest' are to be shown on the hotelroom televisions. The food in the restaurant is served with the same spartanic principles of cultural correctness: A steak is a piece of very red meat and nothing else, fish is nothing more then a very dead sea animal and you have to be made aware of this fact. But all these things can be considered as funny, or -at most- original. The worst thing however is the attitude of the staff. I have never experienced such a group of pretentious, unwelcoming, self absorbed staff members as here and it made me feel ashamed towards my fellow seminar attendants, who came from all over Europe. Not all Dutch people are like this, guys.

Reviews.Title: “Love or Hate”
Reviews.Author: LondonTabs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Lloyd.Three stops on the tram from Centraal Station. The star ratings are somewhat confusing and room allocation seemed to be a bit of 'Pot Luck'. Every room is unique and intriguing, designed by leading Dutch designers with unusual concepts. We stayed in a 'four star' room which was very comfortable and unusual, a little on the small side. The shower room lay in between what was a sitting room (our son's bed) and our bedroom and reminded me of a sports changing room.One would need to know the people you shared with very well as the toilet is far from private. However after the initial reaction we embraced hotel's 'quirkiness'. We were greeted with warmth and made to feel at home.Service was a little laid back but this is Amsterdam! Breakfast was comprehensive and not too expensive. The bar is small but very reasonable prices and as guests we were able to take our drinks into a comfortable seating area in the restaurant and chill on the sofas. We were able to explore and take in the Hotel's somewhat sad history and its jubilant restoration.There was a Library with free internet access, a maze of stairwells and interesting mezzanine floors ,combining old, original with ultra modern.This is not the run of the mill Hotel! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights wished it was two weeks”
Reviews.Author: hsunnyg
Reviews.Content: Having been in Amsterdam before i was aware that many of the hotels are small, some expensive for the state of the room presented. So it was refreshing to find the lloyds hotel close to Central Station and which looked a good standard of accomodation. On arrival my husband and I were allocated a room on the top floor, the whole area entering our rooms seemed so remote from the rest of the hotel and the room was so dark, as the windows were high any view was only achieved by standing on a chair. I knew I could not stay a night in such a room. I went to reception and explained and was given the keys of another room wihout any fuss and was told it was important that guests were happy. Our next room on the second floor was aboslutely beautiful, all in white with designer furnishings, so light and airy. The rest of the hotel was great, a library for guests with an amazing range of art literature, the resturant is slightly exensive but he service was good and the bar had a cheery barman. I would recommend and certainly return to Lloyds.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: bigstampy
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual hotel, different from the normal run of the mill. I had a large and comfortable room, minimalist design which actually turned out to be quite relaxing! Its a few stops on the tram from the city, the road is reasonably quiet. The tram stop is close by, as is the canal hopper service. If you like design, or want to try something different then this might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Must-See if you appreciate Art/Design or just want something different”
Reviews.Author: stephanapolis
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3-star room at the Lloyd with my boyfriend as a last minute weekend getaway and I have to say it exceeded my expectations! After reading the reviews here (many, if not most, being negative) I was prepared for the worst and ready to immediately ask for a change of rooms if necessary, but when I walked into our room (420, haha) all of my worries were set at ease as the room was absolutely lovely! One of the largest hotel rooms I've stayed in. Clean, and super-stylish interior design (if you "get it"). You'll see in my pictures that there are 4 large windows, and although there is no standard wall-to-wall carpeting (boring!) there are soft, funky rugs instead. True there is no blow dryer, but you can phone the front desk and they will bring one straight up to you. The front of house staff were great- went out of their way to phone up restaurants to see if their kitchens were still open when we wanted to go out late and found US to Dutch adapters for us. The location of the hotel is a simple 5-10 minute tram ride from central Amsterdam (and costs around 1.60 euro), never take a taxi unless you have to! It's a waste of money. In short, People that don't like this hotel are either unlucky to get a bad room (in which case they should just ask for another one!) or just simply don't understand that the Lloyd is trying to do something different from other corporate, money-machine hotels. The Lloyd manages to pull off being a boutique/art hotel without being pretentious, and is a great value for the money. If you're looking for somewhere special to stay in Amsterdam, go to the Lloyd!!

Reviews.Title: “No Class”
Reviews.Author: bubskj
Reviews.Content: The Lloyd Hotel is the worst hotel I have stayed in when I've been to Amsterdam. The Staff were friendly(happy 2 order cabs when needed), although we didn't need them for much. You can tell straight away that the hotel used to be a prison and this is reflected throughout the hotel in the rooms, corridors, bathrooms etc. We stayed in a quad room, and were given a double bed and 2 single, what looked to be, hospital beds. in between the rooms was the bathroom, and this was very inconvenient for us. The whole set up of the room was wrong. However, this was only for the quad room(other rooms are probably slightly different) We didn't even bother trying to walk to Dam square, it felt like we were in the middle of no where with no local shops for food. A cab took us about 10 mins, so walking would have been close to 40mins. I could go on about this hotel, but luckily we only stayed there for 3 nights. its better to spend an extra Â£30 for a better hotel a bit closer to Dam square, it'll also save you money on cabs. All in all, it was definitely an experience, staying at the hotel, but not one that I'd like to have again.

Reviews.Title: “Weird”
Reviews.Author: sbluey
Reviews.Content: I booked this under a mistaken recommendation, apparently the LLoyd is a popular name for a hotel! I was also pretty impressed by the 5* room photos on the hotel's website so I thought I'd give it a whirl. After waiting for 10 minutes for the receptionist (sitting in a booth not much larger than a London phone box) to finish her phone call, I was able to scruitinize the dining room and the grotty tiles lining the floor of this former prison. For the next 12 hours (thank goodness) of my stay this was always in the back of my mind. My room had a quirky, sauna-esque tinterior with a bed big enough for 8 people! (It was a great shame I was staying alone). The bathroom was a lurid green which the most uncomfortable looking bath I've ever seen. In short I wouldn't stay here again, but it was an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, quirky, different...”
Reviews.Author: traveller1Helsinki
Reviews.Content: The people who give this hotel bad reviews simply do not get it. If you travel constantly and are fed up of your standard business hotel with rooms laid out in USA style, of boring rooms, of standardised service etc etc, then this place is a breath of fresh air. It is stylish and quirky. The restaurant is excellent. Way above the standard of most hotel restaurants, except the very best 5 star ones. The best thing about this hotel is that it is DIFFERENT. If you are unsettled about that and only want the standard and normal, then it is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God!”
Reviews.Author: anywherewilldo
Reviews.Content: Well, Well, Wellâ€¦â€¦Where do I start with this Hotel! I think to sum up this hotel I would say this. If you are looking for your partner to divorce you book this hotel, If you are looking at getting lucky, keep dreaming! This hotel is an embarrassment and the comedy of errors were the only things that kept us smiling. Night 1- Arrived around 11, Given room 2 downstairs in the basement. Entered room, it was smelly, musty and generally the sort of room you would put your step mother in when she comes to visit so she would not come again. The following morning having a shower, it started to flood the room! Off to the office I go and demand a better room. Which to their credit I was given. Off to Breakfast, Advise skip it, at 12 Euros Macdonald's has more appeal! Night 2- 1.30am in the Morning, Awoken by knocks on the door and then the door opens to a staff member coming in. I have no idea what he wanted but a few - ---s later he ran away, He was lucky I was half a sleep or he would have had something thrown at him across the room. The remaining two nights we had no adventures or nightmares but on checking out I complained again about the room downstairs and the lady on the desk said "yeah I would agree they are not the best of rooms". I wouldnâ€™t mind the hotel as much if I was paying backpackers rates, but at nearly $700 Euro I would expect some class and care to attention. They donâ€™t even tell you the tram track is just a short walk over the back, or that they actually sell you Tram passes. To be honest the rooms have no information in them about the area or anything like that. I would most definitely recommend people stay clear of this hotel and I am just lucky I got out of Amsterdam with my wife not looking for a divorce!

Reviews.Title: “not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: ernavandeven
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel. I was told you could compare it to the Hotel New York in Rotterdam. Unfortunately I must say you can't compare them. I liked the Rotterdam Hotel far more. We stayed at a 3 star room. The bathtube was in the middle of the room therefor you hardly could open the closet. It was also diffucult to get into bed. You had to crumble to get in. I think the room was overpriced: 130 euro, breakfast 12,50 euro pp. The frontdesk was very small so you had to wait quite some time. It took about 30 minutes before someone could explain me how I could get to the address where I had my businessmeeting.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and unbelievably long check out time”
Reviews.Author: Optomistictraveller1
Reviews.Content: On the positive side the beds are extremely comfortable. Not really any discernable difference between the 3* and 4* rooms that we booked - if anything the 3* one was slightly nicer (4* room had very tatty rug in it which impacted on the overall look of the room). The bathrooms have been mentioned a lot on previous reviews - the system of opening the cupboard doors to create an enclosed bathroom is quite innovative and different and we worked out how to use it pretty quickly. I can understand why some people didn't though and think it would make sense for people checking into those rooms to be told how the bathroom works when they check in to avoid confusion. We arrived to find that we couldn't check in until 3.00pm at the weekend, which hadn't been made clear when the reservation was made and was a bit of a hassle as we'd intended to get changed before heading out for the afternoon. Again - would make sense to just let people know that the check in time is fairly late on in the afternoon so there are no surprises. Overall the website gives a much better impression of the hotel than the reality. I like quirky hotels, but they can be done a lot better than this. A comparable example would be the Malmaison hotel in Oxford which was an old prison and has retained it's quirkiness and character, but has significantly higher quality decor, facilities and service for the same price as a 3* star room in this hotel. The main issue however was the check out process. The reception area is ridiculously small and the queue for checkout was huge which meant that the narrow corridor beside the reception was very crowded and it was hard to be clear who should go next. The checkout process also seemed to be ridiculously slow with numerous phone calls needing to be made and details needing to be checked - this should not have been a complex process. It was as if they weren't used to lots of people checking out at the same time - this was 12.00 on a Sunday - surely they should be used to handling relatively high volumes of people at this time and manage to handle it with a modicum of efficiency. There was an extra room service charge on my bill that I hadn't ordered or signed for, but when I told the receptionist that was the case he said that it could be rectified but it would take a while - it was as if he was expecting me to say 'OK then don't worry I'll just go ahead and pay it to save you time'. When he finally did agree to take the incorrect charge off my bill he wasn't at all apologetic. I then received an e-mail the next day from the night porter who had served me the room service that I actually had ordered (and been more than happy to pay for) saying that I had declined to pay for it and implying that I was lying about having placed the order. This should not have been a major issue - incorrect charges get applied to bills all the time - but when that does happen and it's quite clear that a mistake has been made, hotel staff should deal with it quickly and efficiently and with good grace - not make the guest feel that they are being out of order for refusing to pay for goods that they have not received. I would definitely not recommend this hotel or stay there again - unless your only concern is a comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “The most impractical hotel on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Monkeychops37
Reviews.Content: Just don't do it, the place is crap on so many levels. 1) Shower is in the middle of the room especially designed with no screens so the cold concrete painted red floor gets splashed and you nearly break your neck afterwards. 2) No mini bar or kettle 3)The place used to be a borstal, not a lot has changed, so everywhere echoes and bangs, noise is a problem there. 4) Want food? Well it will cost you 8 euros to get anything delivered, and if you want to pick it up, expect to wait 45mins for a cheese and ham toasty. 5) Showergel, nah, forget it, have an old fashioned bar of soap. 6) If you want a shower, then practice pushing yourself up against a wall and trickle some water down the wall and use a bar of soap, if you find it easy then well done this place is for you. 7) They apparently get 100 complaints a week, the management apparently said to the staff that they aren't bothered about repeat business. If you like form without function go there, unfortunately i think the two should work hand in hand, this is a badly thought out place, with a smattering of design that doesn't work in improving your stay. Utter rubbish

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Altenative in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: after my stay here I had to laugh when I read the review below where somebody complained about the 'minimal room with a dixi bathroom'. Obvioulsy this hotel is not for everybody. The 'dixi bathroom' is a creation by the Dutch design group Atelier Van Lieshout. Some people find their design unuasal and unpractical, but I guess the Lloyd hotel aims to be an alternative to cookie-cutter chain hotels. I booked the 5* room and when I arrived asked to be shown the available ones as I had heard they were all different. The friendly receptionist accompanied me to 5 different rooms and gave me some explanations. In the end I picked a attic room with a huge pointed room of wooden beams and a large tub in the middle of the room. the bed was large and very comfy. Perhaps 200 EUR is a bit much- but it certainly was vey different from most hotel rooms I stay in. The whole bulding is a gem and very Dutch- and in a way, so are the rooms. They have kept many of the old touches and some furniture- some people would complain about old stuff, others will apprecaiate teh bit of history and authenticity. My only comment would be that the hotel would do well to touch up the paint in the hall ways- many scratchmarks that leave a bit of a worn out first impression. The free wireless internet worked a charm- you also get a free 'adult entertainment' channel at night (confiming one Amsterdam stereotype...) The restaurant/ bar looked nice, there was pleasant live music and an art performance the night I stayed. The surroundings give you the opportunity to explore a different side of Amsterdam, although I think many visitors will still prefer to spend most of their time in the historic center. But there are some bars and shops around and it is all very authetically Dutch- just not as old as the center. My only gripe would be that the tram could run a little more often (currently only once every 15mins at night) So if you are looking for an interetsing alternative in amsterdam, and have an interest in design and art the Lloyd might be for you. If you want 4* creature comforst, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Former Prison that has not changed much”
Reviews.Author: pipsa-suomi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a former prison that has not changed much. Leave it to the dutch to design a hostel (disguished as a hotel) that has five classes of room that only vary really in size and whether or not there is a "bathroom" in the room. Bathroom is in quotations as the ones in the room are pre-fab fiberglass installations improperly stuated in the center of the room in some cases. There is a noticeable pumping action when the shower is in use, apparently removing the waste water. I wondered why a pump was needed on the fifth floor The quote unquote five star rooms have no refrigerator, no air (dreadful this past summer), lightbulbs hanging from a chord on the ceiling. Staff were friendly but very limited. Finally, I would like to think that the "five star" rooms were subsidizing the less well off one star tenants (in this prison tenament) but it appears that they were paying inflated prices as well. Finally, the best (and one of the few) feature of the hotel was the outdoor terrace restuarant with its very dedicated staff and great menu and drink and the hotel's proximity to public transportation and a grocery store. Finally, its best for those who want the deja vu of reliving the hostel experience WITHOUT the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - but not 'Exceptional'”
Reviews.Author: dreammachine
Reviews.Content: The Lloyd hotel is a nice place, in a decent location, and staffed with some nice people. The history of the building is interesting and my walk around the area (this being low season) was not incredible - but was pleasant. The best thing about the hotel is that it is clean and open - and somewhat secluded. The pricing is not bad for low season. However, the thing to watch out for (and this is demonstrated in some of the other guest complaints) is the unique way in which the hotel categorizes the rooms. I booked for 3 nights and was happy with my room. But, being a category 4 room I expected something a bit more than what I got - it was basic and not interesting- certainly not exceptional. There is much said about the interiors and furniture, etc... but I found that much of it is hyperbole. There is much difference between a 1 and a 5 perhaps - but I suggest you pay close attention to anything in between. Many of the rooms are not much of an improvement on category 1 - except space. But, there are some gems to be found. Just make sure you get one! The public space is well designed and interesting. I visited in the low season, of course, and as such the atmosphere was slower - but I can imagine the Lloyd holds its own when it comes to the high season festivities. I was just pleased to be in Amsterdam and the hotel room sufficed. I suggest, if you are travelling soon, checking out the old Postal building housing the Stedelijk - either in the day or night..... the view is great... especially while dancing! The central train station is really not that far away - and the tram station behind the hotel is very safe, clean, and quite modern! Either the tram 10 or 26 can get you anywhere you want to go pretty quickly! Decent place, interesting history - but nothing truly exceptional apart from the public area and engaging staff!

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable horrible”
Reviews.Author: nataliecurfew
Reviews.Content: we booked a 5*-room but what we got was a big hostelroom with a dixi-bathroom next to the bed. it was very noisy (you heard the wind outside very loudly) and uncomfortable. the style was very rustic like on a farm, no luxury feeling at all how you would expect it in a 5*-room. it was so horrible that we decided not to stay there. only plus: they didn't charge the reservation. watch the pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: jlynnnyc
Reviews.Content: Another reviewer wrote that the Lloyd Hotel is a bit like staying in an Ikea. I agree, but in a good way. The rooms are inventive (showers in the middle of the room, moving walls, etc.). My sibling and I (we're in our mid-twenties) really enjoyed staying here. My parents (in their 50s), however, weren't as thrilled with the atmosphere. It's off the beaten tourist track, but still convenient to public transportation (a nearby tram stop runs to Centraal station every 15-min. or so). The downside to the location is the lack of places to eat immediately surrounding it. The only nighttime option was the hotel's restaurant. The restaurant is as idiosyncratic as the rooms. The whole menu is a la carte and has everything from hummus sandwiches to baked potatoes to scrambled eggs--all served 24 hrs. Prices, however, are on the steep side and there's a whopping 7-euro fee for room service. The building itself is a converted school and prison. There's an interesting exhibit about the history inside. As such, the interior feels a bit industrial, which I liked, but which might not be for everyone. There's also a cultural center inside the hotel w/a library. A concert hall is nearby as well. Oh yes, and there's a free porn channel. I love Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: luvluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Its such a cool hotel! We only stayed in their 1 star room. The room was really small, and we couldn't look out the window, but I must say that the beds were really clean and comfortable. The architecture of Lloyd Hotel is so uniquely designed. The place has many windows, which made it very bright. Internet is free, which is so important. The staff were generally very friendly. The also have 2 supermarket close by. The tram 26 from Centraal Station only took 8 minutes. The place was so posh that the day we were heading out, we noticed a lot of tall and beautiful girls in the hallway. They were holding folders, which happened to be portfolios. There were about 20-50 models just waiting to audition for some sort of hair commercial. Says a lot about the place. Highly recommend it! It's close to the city, but not right in the city

Reviews.Title: “Magic”
Reviews.Author: HighSpeed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came from Paris and decided to treat ourselves to 3 nights in one of the 5* Unforgettable rooms. We got the one with the gigantic down bed. Very large room esp. for Europe, bed was like sleeping in clouds, food was great , service was excellent, and tram stops right at the front door. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “questionable behavior”
Reviews.Author: jkotinis
Reviews.Content: I booked through Expedia the hotel and paid for a 4 star room. This because I wanted light from windows. From the photos on the web , I understood that 4 star rooms at least had quite much of light. We checked in and we found ourselves on 5th floor (lower level of roof) with a small window of 40*90 cm, very very dark but yes big though. I checked with the reception and they confirmed that this room (520) is a 4 star room. At the evening I want to ask again the reception because the room was so dark and with no fresh air (window could open by a small portion of 5 cm). I found another receptionist and I chhecked again. This guy told me that this is a 3 star room. When I told him that the receptionist in the morning told me that this is a 4 star room , as I had booked online, he said that he was mistaken and he didn't know the category of this room. I said that this is big problem, since it seemed to me that they cheated me (by accident or not). Next morning I ask for the manager to another receptionist, and she admits (receptionist) finally that the room is indeed a 3 star room and that a mistake was made. She offered to find an alternative room of 4 stars , we checked this, the new one was 4 star with light and fresh air. Finally we didn't move (we didn't want to loose time on moving things around) and the only thing I asked was to find a way to have a refund of the price difference between 3 star and 4 star rooms. Receptionist said that will do that (don't actually know what happened till now) and also they offered us 2 breakfasts and also a basket with fruits. The point from my experience is that I paid for something that was not delivered and they tried also to cheat me by telling lies. They preffered not to say that they had made a mistake in bookings and they tried to convienvce me that a 3 star room was a 4 star room. That's unacceptable and unprofessional bahavior , from my point of view So my only advise is to double check when you make a booking in this lovely, modern, young and charming hotel (in all other aspects)

Reviews.Title: “Cobwebs, no light - a shambles”
Reviews.Author: MsPs
Reviews.Content: The two star rooms - described as "surprising" on the lloyd website certainly live up to their name. However, this surprise was more of a shock than a delight. The room, in the basement (by no means a bargain) had no natural light, the door to the room did not close properly (as a woman staying alone this was a worry), cleaning equiptment had been left in the bathroom, no mirror, no hairdryer, tiny tiny bed and worst of all pipes which led down through my room so you could hear when anyone above had flushed the loo - the pipes were covered in cobwebs and spiders - this room cannot have been cleaned for a long time. Absolutely awful - stay in the Hotel Bellevue if you want cheap, pleasant and clean instead. I wish I had photos to share how awful this place was.

Reviews.Title: “Special but a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: Iceberg678
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights in a 1* room. Good bed. Room is simple, Dutch style. Bathroom was on the other side of the hall and just a little too shabby. Broken (original) tiles, towels on the floor from other users. Very barren. The hallway was also used as a storage space. Some tables, chairs, a wooden staircase. Very messy impression. Reception is ridiculously small. Management: gives those friendly boys and girls a decent place to work from. Breakfast and reading area is great. Lot of sofas to relax on, newspapers to read. Nice crowd of people who like something different. The area is developing with some nice cafes and restaurants around. Good public transport to the city. Would I go there again... only if I get my own shower. For the 1* room you better go to the Youth Hostel and stay at less than halve of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TravellilngRachael
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in if you expect to be out and about most of the day. The rooms are comfortable, we stayed in a 3* room which had a super comfy double bed, armchair, table and chairs and TV. The bathroom was fine with dcent shower, but like most european hotels there are no tea / coffee making facilities and the room does feel a bit sparse (like Ikea!). The hotel has a relaxed, cafe feel about the place and a very good restaurant. I can recomend the poached pear with chocolate! Staff are very helpful and can reccommend you to a lot of good places of interest - excellent English. The only downsode to this hotel is the fact that the walls are very thin and you can hear people quite clearly in the room / corridoor next to you! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit like staying in IKEA”
Reviews.Author: Clarington
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a 3* room with my husband on our Honeymoon. From reading other reviews we knew the hotel was going to be a bit different and on the arty side. We enjoyed staying at the hotel and liked the room, it was very clean and practical for a short stay. I was glad that the room we got had a separate bathroom, rather than one of the 'fold out' feature bathrooms which I had read about. The bathroom was a 'wet room' (had a shower with no curtain so the water went where it fell) but was designed in a practical way so not everything got wet. The room had shutters rather than curtains and overlooked the water, so on a sunny morning the room was lovely and bright (once the shutters were fully open) and the view was appealing. The location of the hotel is a short tram ride from the centre and the trams are frequent. If you liked walking, you could easily walk into the centre. We choose not too, as we toured Amsterdam by foot when we reached the centre. The area around the hotel is fairly quiet, it looked like it was a business area which went quiet at weekend and in the evenings. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and the whole place had a young and modern feel to it. My husband thought the interior of the hotel was designed in the same style as some of the stuff you see in IKEA, several areas where very open plan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JeffJC
Reviews.Content: I read all the previous reviews on this website and although it felt like a gamble I decided to book a three star room for three nights. As soon as we arrived at the hotel I knew I'd made the right decision as my "classy" girlfriend was delighted with my choice of hotel! The hotel has a tram stop right outside and the number 26 trams run every few minutes and take about 5 minutes to get to the central station (top of the town centre). We also rented bikes and it was a safe, 10 minute ride back from town. The building itself was very impressive and the room was great. I'de never stayed in a room which incorporated a shower in the middle before! The bed and bedding were very high quality and comfortable. Our room was thoroughly cleaned daily. I spent a long time researching the best hotel within my price range before making my choice. I also had a look at a few others in the city centre when I was there. They were generally more expensive than the Lloyd and nowhere near as nice. The staff were always there and happy to help if I needed anything. When reading these reviews remember it's hard to determine which grade of accomodation people stayed in. The hotel offers rooms from one to five stars. I've attached a couple of photos.
